{"body": "<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC \"-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01//EN\"=0A\t \"http://www.w3.org/TR=\n/html4/strict.dtd\">=0A<head>=0A<meta name=3D\"keywords\" content=3D\"Neil Well=\niver, Lois Dodd, Brett Bigbee, Gregory Amenoff, Loren MacIver, Emily Nellig=\nan, Tom Uttech, Vincent Smith, Arthur Dove, Marsden Hartley, John Marin, Al=\nfred Maurer, Stuart Davis, Stieglitz, Anne Harris, Modernist, American Art\">=\n=0A<meta name=3D\"description\" content=3D\"ALEXANDRE GALLERY, NYC, 212-755-28=\n28, Contemporary American art and early 20th century American Modernists an=\nd Stieglitz Group\">=0A<meta name=3D\"verify-v1\" content=3D\"MA5XFwrfN0KkG3+UK=\n7p1WU8QgJeH51m0xmvW9PNd5Kg=3D\"/>\t=0A<meta http-equiv=3D\"Content-Type\" conte=\nnt=3D\"text/html; charset=3Dutf-8\" /> =0A<title>ALEXANDRE GALLERY | Marsden =\nHartley | New Mexico 1918 - 1920 | Press Release</title>=0A<link href=3D\"/f=\navicon.ico\" type=3D\"image/x-icon\" rel=3D\"icon\" /><link href=3D\"/favicon.ico=\n\" type=3D\"image/x-icon\" rel=3D\"shortcut icon\" /><link rel=3D\"stylesheet\" ty=\npe=3D\"text/css\" href=3D\"/css/main.css\" /> =0A=0A<!--[if lte IE 6]>=0A<style=\n type=3D\"text/css\" media=3D\"screen\">=0A\t#wrapper {=0A\t\toverflow:visible;=0A=\n\t}\t\t=0A</style>=0A<![endif]-->=0A=0A<script type=3D\"text/javascript\" src=3D=\n\"/js/artwork.js\"></script></head>=0A<body>=0A<div id=3D'wrapper'>=0A\t<div i=\nd=3D\"header\">=0A\t\t<div id=3D\"topspacer\">&nbsp;</div>=0A\t\t<a href=3D\"/pages\"=\n class=3D\"logo\"><span>Home</span></a>\t\t<div id=3D'menu'>=0A\t\t\t<table class=\n=3D'menu'>=0A\t\t\t\t<tr>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'122'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/exhibit=\nions/current\">Current Exhibition</a>\t\t\t\t\t=0A\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'=\nimg'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td widt=\nh=3D'141'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/exhibitions/upcoming\">Upcoming Exhibitions</=\na>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\"=\n alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'111'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/exhibitions=\n/past\">Past Exhibitions</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"=\n/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'105'>=0A\t\t\t\t=\n\t\t<a href=3D\"/artists\">Artists &amp; Work</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D=\n'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td wid=\nth=3D'173'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/artists/americanModernists\">American Modern=\nist Works</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-=\ncircle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'70'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/p=\nages/contact\">Contact</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/i=\nmg/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'60'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<=\na href=3D\"/artists/prints\">Prints</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t</tr>=0A\t\t\t</table>=\n=0A\t\t</div>=0A\t</div>=0A\t<div id=3D'content'>=0A\t\t\t\t<div class=3D'top-left-=\nimage'>=0A\t<a href=3D\"/exhibitions/view/56\"><img src=3D\"/img/uploads/med_MH=\n19.16newmexico.jpg\" class=3D\"floatLeft goldbox\" alt=3D\"New Mexico Landscape=\n\" /></a></div>=0A<div class=3D'text'>=0A\t<span class=3D'title'><a href=3D\"/=\nartists/view/18\">Marsden Hartley</a> | \t<a href=3D\"/exhibitions/view/56\">Ne=\nw Mexico 1918 - 1920</a> | Press Release</span>=0A\t<br><br>=0A\t<span class=\n=3D'bold'>=0A\tMarsden Hartley | \tNew Mexico 1918 - 1920</span><br>=0A\tAn Am=\nerican Discovering America<br>\tMarch 6 through April 19, 2003<br>\t<br>=0A\t<=\np>This exhibition is presented in association with Mark Borghi Fine        =\n        Art, Inc. and is accompanied by a fully illustrated catalogue with =\n               text by Gail R. Scott, whose work on Hartley includes a mono=\ngraph                published by Abbeville Press, among other books.</p>=\n=0D=0A<p><br /> The galleries are pleased to present the first exhibition t=\no explore                the paintings and pastels created by Marsden Hartl=\ney in New Mexico                during a seventeen month period beginning i=\nn June 1918&mdash;Hartley&rsquo;s                only trip to the American =\nWest. <br /> <br /> Painted in direct response to a vast and austere mounta=\ninous landscape,                these works are characterized by bold, musc=\nular marks, brilliant                raw color and a deep emotional and spi=\nritual connection with both                his new surroundings and the ide=\na of an \"American\" landscape.                Often overlooked in Hartley sc=\nholarship (including the current Wadsworth                Atheneum retrospe=\nctive) and overshadowed by the later New Mexico                Recollection=\ns (painted in Europe), these New Mexico pictures mark                Hartle=\ny&rsquo;s first extended involvement with the American landscape           =\n     after his assimilation of European modernism and abstraction. Hartley&=\nrsquo;s                engagement in the landscape and exploration of natur=\nalistic styles                during this period establish the foundation o=\nf his later Dogtown                and Maine masterpieces. Scott says of th=\nis period in the exhibition                catalogue:</p>=0D=0A<p><br /> Ne=\nw Mexico (was) a place where he was forced by the sheer immensity          =\n      and strangeness of the landscape to come to terms with his past      =\n          and future. Through intellect, creative energy, and determination=\n,                he forged a new union between his solid grounding in Europ=\nean modernism                (1912-15) and his rediscovery of America as la=\nndscape.<br /> <br /> The exhibition will include major loans from public a=\nnd private                collections including the Ogunquit Museum of Amer=\nican Art (Maine),                Whitney Museum of American Art, Weisman Mu=\nseum of Art (Ione and                Hudson Walker Collection) and Curtis G=\nalleries (Minneapolis). <br /> <br /> The accompanying catalogue includes a=\n facsimile of the 1921 Anderson                Galleries auction brochure o=\nrganized by Alfred Stieglitz (from which                the New Mexico work=\ns were sold) and original texts written by Hartley                while in =\nNew Mexico. In the 1918 article America as Landscape Hartley               =\n writes \"I am an American discovering America. I like the position         =\n       and I like the results.\"</p></div>=0A<div class=3D'goldbox'>=0A\t<ul>=\n=0A\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/view/Marsden-Hartley\" class=3D\"title\">Marsde=\nn Hartley</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/exhibitions/view/56\"><span clas=\ns=3D'title'>New Mexico 1918 - 1920</span><br>March 6 through April 19, 2003=\n</a>\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<ul>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li>Press Release</li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</ul>=\n=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t</li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/worksAvailable/Marsde=\nn-Hartley\">Works Available</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/w=\norksExhibited/Marsden-Hartley\">Works Exhibited</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><=\na href=3D\"/artists/essays/Marsden-Hartley\">Essays &amp; Interviews</a></li>=\n=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/exhibitions/Marsden-Hartley\">Past Ex=\nhibitions</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</ul>=0A</div>\t</div>=0A\t</div>=0A<div id=3D'=\nlink'>=0A\t<a href=3D\"http://www.kyung.com\" target=3D\"_blank\" class=3D\"kyung=\nLink\">Web design by kyung.com</a></div>=0A<script type=3D\"text/javascript\">=\n=0Avar gaJsHost =3D ((\"https:\" =3D=3D document.location.protocol) ? return false;\"><img src=3D\"/img/uplo=\nads/small_AD41_9_Pyramid0.jpg\" alt=3D\"Pyramid Formation\" /></a></td><td><a =\nhref=3D\"/artworks/view/299/0\" onclick=3D\"popup(this); return false;\"><img s=\nrc=3D\"/img/uploads/small_AD40_5UntitledSun5.jpg\" alt=3D\"Untitled (Sun)\" /><=\n/a></td><td>&nbsp;</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr></table>\t</div>=0A\t</div>=0A<div=\n id=3D'link'>=0A\t<a href=3D\"http://www.kyung.com\" target=3D\"_blank\" class=\n=3D\"kyungLink\">Web design by kyung.com</a></div>=0A<script type=3D\"text/jav=\nascript\">=0Avar gaJsHost =3D ((\"https:\" =3D=3D document.location.protocol) =\n? \"https://ssl.\" :=0A\"http://www.\");=0Adocument.write(unescape(\"%3Cscript s=\nrc=3D'\" + gaJsHost +=0A\"google-analytics.com/ga.js' type=3D'text/javascript=\n'%3E%3C/script%3E\"));=0A</script>=0A<script type=3D\"text/javascript\">=0Atry=\n {=0Avar pageTracker =3D _gat._getTracker(\"UA-8410440-1\");=0ApageTracker._t=\nrackPageview();=0A} catch(err) {}</script>=0A</body>=0A</html>=0A", "code": 200, "level": 2, "url": "http://alexandregallery.com/exhibitions/view/13", "text": null, "time": 0.6099240779876709, "redirect_urls": [], "headers": {"Content-Length": "2970", "Content-Encoding": "gzip", "Set-Cookie": "CAKEPHP=ce08b627491b89e818eeb7841d5ea615; {"body": "<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC \"-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01//EN\"=0A\t \"http://www.w3.org/TR=\n/html4/strict.dtd\">=0A<head>=0A<meta name=3D\"keywords\" content=3D\"Neil Well=\niver, Lois Dodd, Brett Bigbee, Gregory Amenoff, Loren MacIver, Emily Nellig=\nan, Tom Uttech, Vincent Smith, Arthur Dove, Marsden Hartley, John Marin, Al=\nfred Maurer, Stuart Davis, Stieglitz, Anne Harris, Modernist, American Art\">=\n=0A<meta name=3D\"description\" content=3D\"ALEXANDRE GALLERY, NYC, 212-755-28=\n28, Contemporary American art and early 20th century American Modernists an=\nd Stieglitz Group\">=0A<meta name=3D\"verify-v1\" content=3D\"MA5XFwrfN0KkG3+UK=\n7p1WU8QgJeH51m0xmvW9PNd5Kg=3D\"/>\t=0A<meta http-equiv=3D\"Content-Type\" conte=\nnt=3D\"text/html; charset=3Dutf-8\" /> =0A<title>ALEXANDRE GALLERY | Arthur D=\nove | Arthur Dove: Watercolors | Press Release</title>=0A<link href=3D\"/fav=\nicon.ico\" type=3D\"image/x-icon\" rel=3D\"icon\" /><link href=3D\"/favicon.ico\" =\ntype=3D\"image/x-icon\" rel=3D\"shortcut icon\" /><link rel=3D\"stylesheet\" type=\n=3D\"text/css\" href=3D\"/css/main.css\" /> =0A=0A<!--[if lte IE 6]>=0A<style t=\nype=3D\"text/css\" media=3D\"screen\">=0A\t#wrapper {=0A\t\toverflow:visible;=0A\t}=\n\t\t=0A</style>=0A<![endif]-->=0A=0A<script type=3D\"text/javascript\" src=3D\"/=\njs/artwork.js\"></script></head>=0A<body>=0A<div id=3D'wrapper'>=0A\t<div id=\n=3D\"header\">=0A\t\t<div id=3D\"topspacer\">&nbsp;</div>=0A\t\t<a href=3D\"/pages\" =\nclass=3D\"logo\"><span>Home</span></a>\t\t<div id=3D'menu'>=0A\t\t\t<table class=\n=3D'menu'>=0A\t\t\t\t<tr>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'122'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/exhibit=\nions/current\">Current Exhibition</a>\t\t\t\t\t=0A\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'=\nimg'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td widt=\nh=3D'141'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/exhibitions/upcoming\">Upcoming Exhibitions</=\na>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\"=\n alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'111'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/exhibitions=\n/past\">Past Exhibitions</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"=\n/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'105'>=0A\t\t\t\t=\n\t\t<a href=3D\"/artists\">Artists &amp; Work</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D=\n'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td wid=\nth=3D'173'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/artists/americanModernists\">American Modern=\nist Works</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-=\ncircle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'70'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/p=\nages/contact\">Contact</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/i=\nmg/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'60'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<=\na href=3D\"/artists/prints\">Prints</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t</tr>=0A\t\t\t</table>=\n=0A\t\t</div>=0A\t</div>=0A\t<div id=3D'content'>=0A\t\t\t\t<div class=3D'top-left-=\nimage'>=0A\t<a href=3D\"/exhibitions/view/13\"><img src=3D\"/img/uploads/med_AD=\n43.1_Untitled0.jpg\" class=3D\"floatLeft goldbox\" alt=3D\"Untitled 8-14-43\" />=\n</a></div>=0A<div class=3D'text'>=0A\t<span class=3D'title'><a href=3D\"/arti=\nsts/view/17\">Arthur Dove</a> | \t<a href=3D\"/exhibitions/view/13\">Arthur Dov=\ne: Watercolors</a> | Press Release</span>=0A\t<br><br>=0A\t<span class=3D'bol=\nd'>=0A\tArthur Dove | \tArthur Dove: Watercolors</span><br>=0A\t\tMay 13 throug=\nh June 23, 2006<br>Benefit Reception at the gallery on Wednesday, May 24th,=\n 5:30 to 7:30pm<br>\t<br>=0A\t<p><span style=3D\"font-family: Arial,Helvetica,=\nGeneva,Swiss,SunSans-Regular;\">Traveling to the Heckscher Museum of Art Jul=\ny 11 through September 3, 2006</span></p>=0D=0A<p>&nbsp;</p>=0D=0A<p><span =\nstyle=3D\"font-family: Arial,Helvetica,Geneva,Swiss,SunSans-Regular;\">The ga=\nllery is pleased to announce an exhibition of Arthur Dove (1880&mdash;1946)=\n watercolors. Conceived as a jewel-like survey of the best available exampl=\nes of this seldom seen and still lesser understood aspect of Dove&rsquo;s w=\nork, the show will include works from 1930, the year in which he both took =\nup the medium in earnest and made it an intrinsic aspect of his artistic en=\ndeavor, through the mid-1940s, when failing health slowed his output, but n=\not his creative spirit and stylistic innovation. The show will represent th=\ne largest and most comprehensive gathering of these drawings to date.<br />=\n <br /> Including more than fifty-five watercolors, the full range and scop=\ne of Dove&rsquo;s interests and achievement will be on view. All works will=\n be borrowed from either private collections or museums, including The Herb=\nert F. Johnson Museum, Cornell University (Dove&rsquo;s alma mater), the He=\nckscher Museum of Art (which includes the recently founded Newsday Center f=\nor Dove/Torr Studies), and The Phillips Collection (which holds the largest=\n single collection of Dove&rsquo;s work). Late sketchbook pages will be rep=\nresented by The Arkansas Arts Center and The McNay Art Museum, both of whic=\nh were among a handful of institutions to receive gifts from the Dove famil=\ny. Also included will be a select group of works never before seen in publi=\nc on loan from the Dove Estate.<br /> <br /> The exhibition will be accompa=\nnied by an eighty page illustrated catalogue with texts by Debra Bricker Ba=\nlken and Anne Cohen DePietro. Balken, a leading scholar of the first genera=\ntion American modernists, was the lead curator of the 1997&mdash;98 Dove re=\ntrospective, which traveled to the Whitney Museum, among other venues. DePi=\netro is founding Project Director of the Dove/Torr Study Center at the Heck=\nscher Museum, to where the exhibition will travel in July.<br /> <br /> Sma=\nll in scale (usually measuring 5 x 7 inches, and later 3 x 4 or 4 x 5 inche=\ns), Dove&rsquo;s watercolors achieve radiance and use the translucent color=\n to describe conditions of light and space. Common motifs include the sea, =\nsun, wind, and the many rhythms and cycles of nature. Often using the fluid=\n black line of a fountain pen to delineate form within the color, Dove&rsqu=\no;s imagery moves increasingly toward abstraction in the late 1930s and ear=\nly 40s. Usually intended as studies for larger paintings, it is through the=\nse watercolors on paper that Dove first forged his most inventive and far-r=\neaching expression.<br /> <br /> Balken writes, &ldquo; . . . watercolor be=\ncame (beginning in 1930) a routine staple of his output. In fact, the mediu=\nm represented a new formal challenge for Dove, its temporal dimension a met=\naphoric match for the mutable characteristics of nature.&rdquo; She continu=\nes, &ldquo;his formal language alternated between organic and quasi-geometr=\nic forms; nature now (after 1938) became construed as a dynamic yet wholly =\nunknowable and mysterious structure.&rdquo;<br /> <br /> Even at his most a=\nbstract, however, Dove&rsquo;s subjects and imagery are rooted in direct ob=\nservation and deep understanding of the natural world. DePietro writes, &ld=\nquo;Throughout his life, even as he moved steadily toward abstraction, his =\nwork retained discernable elements that eloquently convey the spirit and ge=\nography of the rural communities in which he lived.&rdquo;<br /> <br /> Art=\nhur Garfield Dove was born in 1880 in Geneva, New York, the son a successfu=\nl contractor and builder. After graduating Cornell University in 1903, Dove=\n defied his father and set-off for New York where he briefly pursued a care=\ner as a commercial illustrator to support his art. Following a trip to Euro=\npe to visit Alfred Maurer, Dove is credited as the first American&mdash;per=\nhaps first international&mdash;artist to create wholly abstract paintings (=\n1910&mdash;11). After living in then rural communities (including Westport =\nand Noroton, Connecticut) around New York City in the teens and early 1920s=\n, Dove and his companion (later to be his second wife) Helen Torr, purchase=\nd a 42 yawl in 1922. They made their home on this boat for five years befor=\ne settling in Halesite on the North Shore of Long Island. In 1933 Dove and =\nTorr returned to Dove&rsquo;s childhood home of Geneva to settle his parent=\ns&rsquo; estate. Five years later, in 1938, they returned to Long Island So=\nund and made their final home in a cottage on a tidal inlet in Centerport, =\nNew York (now the Dove/Torr Cottage).<br /> <br /> During his life, Dove ex=\nhibited his work regularly at the galleries of his dealer and patron Alfred=\n Stieglitz He is considered a core member of the &ldquo;Stieglitz Group,&rd=\nquo; which includes artists such as Marsden Hartley, John Marin and Georgia=\n O&rsquo;Keeffe. Following Stieglitz&rsquo; death, also in 1946, Dove&rsquo=\n;s Estate was represented by Edith Halpert&rsquo;s The Downtown Gallery, an=\nd then later by Terry Dintenfass. Major traveling exhibitions of Dove&rsquo=\n;s work were organized in 1974 by Barbara Haskell (then at the San Francisc=\no Museum of Modern Art), and in 1997 by Debra Balken (for the Addison Galle=\nry of American Art).<br /> <br /> In 1998 Dove and Torr&rsquo;s final home =\nwas acquired by the Heckscher Musuem of Art with assistance of the Times-Mi=\nrror corporation and the New York State Department of Parks, Recreation and=\n Historic Preservation. This site is being restored to its condition at the=\n time that Dove and Torr lived there together (1938 &ndash; 1946). The News=\nday Center for Dove/Torr Studies is a founding member of Historic Artists&r=\nsquo; Homes and Studios, a program of the National Trust for Historic Prese=\nrvation. In 2002 the cottage was named to Save America&rsquo;s Treasures, a=\n White House Millennium Council initiative focused on &ldquo;protecting Ame=\nrica&rsquo;s threatened cultural treasures.&rdquo; Charles C. Eldridge, for=\nmer director of the Smithsonian Museum of American Art, writes of the site,=\n &ldquo;I can think of few properties with as singular an importance for th=\ne rich history of modern art in America.&rdquo;<br /> <br /> On Wednesday, =\nMay 24 (5:30 to 7:30 pm), Alexandre Gallery will host a benefit reception f=\nor the Heckscher&rsquo;s Dove/Torr Cottage and Study Center. Both Debra Bal=\nken and Anne DePietro will be present and make brief presentations on Dove&=\nrsquo;s work and life. </span></p></div>=0A<div class=3D'goldbox'>=0A\t<ul>=\n=0A\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/view/Arthur-Dove\" class=3D\"title\">Arthur Dov=\ne</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/exhibitions/view/13\"><span class=3D'tit=\nle'>Arthur Dove: Watercolors</span><br>May 13 through June 23, 2006</a>\t\t\t\t=\n\t\t\t<ul>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li>Press Release</li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a =\nhref=3D\"/exhibitions/press/13\">Press</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</ul>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t=\n</li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/worksAvailable/Arthur-Dove\">Wo=\nrks Available</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/worksExhibited=\n/Arthur-Dove\">Works Exhibited</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artist=\ns/press/Arthur-Dove\">Press</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/e=\nssays/Arthur-Dove\">Essays &amp; Interviews</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a hr=\nef=3D\"/artists/exhibitions/Arthur-Dove\">Past Exhibitions</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t=\n\t\t</ul>=0A</div>\t</div>=0A\t</div>=0A<div id=3D'link'>=0A\t<a href=3D\"http://=\nwww.kyung.com\" target=3D\"_blank\" class=3D\"kyungLink\">Web design by kyung.co=\nm</a></div>=0A<script type=3D\"text/javascript\">=0Avar gaJsHost =3D ((\"https=\n:\" =3D=3D document.location.protocol) ? \"https://ssl.\" :=0A\"http://www.\");=\n=0Adocument.write(unescape(\"%3Cscript src=3D'\" + gaJsHost +=0A\"google-analy=\ntics.com/ga.js' type=3D'text/javascript'%3E%3C/script%3E\"));=0A</script>=0A=\n<script type=3D\"text/javascript\">=0Atry {=0Avar pageTracker =3D _gat._getTr=\nacker(\"UA-8410440-1\");=0ApageTracker._trackPageview();=0A} catch(err) {}</s=\ncript>=0A</body>=0A</html>=0A", "code": 200, "level": 2, "url": "http://alexandregallery.com/exhibitions/pressRelease/13", "text": "Press Release", "time": 0.24969887733459473, "redirect_urls": [], "headers": {"Content-Length": "4585", "Content-Encoding": "gzip", "Set-Cookie": "CAKEPHP=9164e83005877943475209963cc1137f; expires=Fri, 06 Jul 2012 23:54:40 GMT; path=/,CAKEPHP=9164e83005877943475209963cc1137f; expires=Fri, 06 Jul 2012 23:54:40 GMT; path=/", "X-Powered-By": "PHP/5.2.4-2ubuntu5.17", "Vary": "Accept-Encoding", "Server": "Apache", "Connection": "close", "Date": "Fri, 29 Jun 2012 23:54:40 GMT", "P3p": "CP=\"NOI ADM DEV PSAi COM NAV OUR OTRo STP IND DEM\"", "Content-Type": "text/html"}, "file_size": 10960, "content_type": "text/html", "biz_id": 633312, "zip_file_name": "alexandregallery.com/exhibitions/pressRelease/13/page-content", "sequence_number": 124}

{"body": "<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC \"-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01//EN\"=0A\t \"http://www.w3.org/TR=\n/html4/strict.dtd\">=0A<head>=0A<meta name=3D\"keywords\" content=3D\"Neil Well=\niver, Lois Dodd, Brett Bigbee, Gregory Amenoff, Loren MacIver, Emily Nellig=\nan, Tom Uttech, Vincent Smith, Arthur Dove, Marsden Hartley, John Marin, Al=\nfred Maurer, Stuart Davis, Stieglitz, Anne Harris, Modernist, American Art\">=\n=0A<meta name=3D\"description\" content=3D\"ALEXANDRE GALLERY, NYC, 212-755-28=\n28, Contemporary American art and early 20th century American Modernists an=\nd Stieglitz Group\">=0A<meta name=3D\"verify-v1\" content=3D\"MA5XFwrfN0KkG3+UK=\n7p1WU8QgJeH51m0xmvW9PNd5Kg=3D\"/>\t=0A<meta http-equiv=3D\"Content-Type\" conte=\nnt=3D\"text/html; charset=3Dutf-8\" /> =0A<title>ALEXANDRE GALLERY | Tom Utte=\nch | Tom Uttech: New Paintings | Press Release</title>=0A<link href=3D\"/fav=\nicon.ico\" type=3D\"image/x-icon\" rel=3D\"icon\" /><link href=3D\"/favicon.ico\" =\ntype=3D\"image/x-icon\" rel=3D\"shortcut icon\" /><link rel=3D\"stylesheet\" type=\n=3D\"text/css\" href=3D\"/css/main.css\" /> =0A=0A<!--[if lte IE 6]>=0A<style t=\nype=3D\"text/css\" media=3D\"screen\">=0A\t#wrapper {=0A\t\toverflow:visible;=0A\t}=\n\t\t=0A</style>=0A<![endif]-->=0A=0A<script type=3D\"text/javascript\" src=3D\"/=\njs/artwork.js\"></script></head>=0A<body>=0A<div id=3D'wrapper'>=0A\t<div id=\n=3D\"header\">=0A\t\t<div id=3D\"topspacer\">&nbsp;</div>=0A\t\t<a href=3D\"/pages\" =\nclass=3D\"logo\"><span>Home</span></a>\t\t<div id=3D'menu'>=0A\t\t\t<table class=\n=3D'menu'>=0A\t\t\t\t<tr>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'122'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/exhibit=\nions/current\">Current Exhibition</a>\t\t\t\t\t=0A\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'=\nimg'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td widt=\nh=3D'141'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/exhibitions/upcoming\">Upcoming Exhibitions</=\na>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\"=\n alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'111'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/exhibitions=\n/past\">Past Exhibitions</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"=\n/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'105'>=0A\t\t\t\t=\n\t\t<a href=3D\"/artists\">Artists &amp; Work</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D=\n'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td wid=\nth=3D'173'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/artists/americanModernists\">American Modern=\nist Works</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-=\ncircle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'70'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/p=\nages/contact\">Contact</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/i=\nmg/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'60'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<=\na href=3D\"/artists/prints\">Prints</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t</tr>=0A\t\t\t</table>=\n=0A\t\t</div>=0A\t</div>=0A\t<div id=3D'content'>=0A\t\t\t\t<div class=3D'top-left-=\nimage'>=0A\t<a href=3D\"/exhibitions/view/61\"><img src=3D\"/img/uploads/med_TU=\n_Enassamishhinjijweian_low.jpg\" class=3D\"floatLeft goldbox\" alt=3D\"Enassami=\nshhinjijweian\" /></a></div>=0A<div class=3D'text'>=0A\t<span class=3D'title'=\n><a href=3D\"/artists/view/13\">Tom Uttech</a> | \t<a href=3D\"/exhibitions/vie=\nw/61\">Tom Uttech: New Paintings</a> | Press Release</span>=0A\t<br><br>=0A\t<=\nspan class=3D'bold'>=0A\tTom Uttech | \tTom Uttech: New Paintings</span><br>=\n=0A\t\tSeptember 24 through November 14, 2009<br>Reception for the artist wil=\nl be Thursday, October 15th, from 6 to 8pm<br>\t<br>=0A\t<p style=3D\"text-ali=\ngn: justify;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The gallery is pleased to present the exhi=\nbition <em>Tom Uttech: New Paintings</em>, on view September 24 through Nov=\nember 14, 2009.&nbsp; There will be a reception for the artist on Thursday,=\n October 15, from 6 to 8 pm. <br /><br />Included in this show, Uttech&rsqu=\no;s third with the gallery, are seventeen paintings completed over the past=\n three years.&nbsp; These paintings range in size between the small-scaled =\n(15 x 18 inches) to the monumental (103 x 112 inches).&nbsp; In each, the a=\nrtist depicts the remote verdant North Woods of Quetico Provincial Park and=\n his native Wisconsin in a style of detailed painterly realism that is both=\n observed and highly imagined&mdash;Uttech makes extended forays alone into=\n the woods, but creates his work in the studio from memory.&nbsp; Uttech&rs=\nquo;s world is entirely untouched by human hands.&nbsp; It is richly popula=\nted with a multitude of animals and birds that inhabit a heightened, rich a=\nnd multi-layered landscape often illuminated by dramatic evening or early m=\norning sky.&nbsp; In Uttech&rsquo;s work the viewer is transported to a vis=\nual paradise and a pre-Cambrian world of millions of years ago, and to a wo=\nrld that is now fragile and fleeting.&nbsp; <br /><br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; =\nLucy Lippard, who wrote for Uttech&rsquo;s 2004 Milwaukee Art Museum retros=\npective, says of these new paintings: <br /><br /><em>Uttech&rsquo;s commit=\nment to the scrubby natural grandeur and spiritual power of this place <br =\n/>is transmitted with extraordinary detail that transcends ordinary experie=\nnce.&nbsp; The sights come not just one by one, but in multitudes.&nbsp; Th=\ne deer, bears, wolves, and above all the birds, animate his canvases until =\nthey reach a visual intensity.&nbsp; While the birds are usually in flight =\nand we can almost hear their voices, the mammals are emblematic, still and =\nsilent.</em><br /><br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Lippard continues:<br /><br />&n=\nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<em> Uttech&rsquo;s paintings evoke the =\ninfinite diversity of an amazing place like this planet.&nbsp; <br />For na=\nture lovers, naturalists, scientists, and ecological activists &ndash; in f=\nact for all of us &ndash; they stand for what we have to loose and what we =\nhave to fight for.</em><br /><br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Tom Uttech was born i=\nn 1942 near Wausau, Wisconsin.&nbsp; After completing studies at the Layton=\n School of Art and University of Cincinnati, he was a professor of art at t=\nhe University of Wisconsin until his resignation in 1998.&nbsp; He has had =\nover 35 one-person exhibitions of his work since it was first exhibited in =\nNew York at the 1975 Whitney Biennial.<br /><br /><strong>For further infor=\nmation or images, please contact Allison Hester at 212-755-2828 or at ahest=\ner@alexandregallery.com<br /></strong></p></div>=0A<div class=3D'goldbox'>=\n=0A\t<ul>=0A\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/view/Tom-Uttech\" class=3D\"title\">Tom=\n Uttech</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/exhibitions/view/61\"><span class=\n=3D'title'>Tom Uttech: New Paintings</span><br>September 24 through Novembe=\nr 14, 2009</a>\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<ul>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li>Press Release</li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t=\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/exhibitions/press/61\">Press</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t=\n\t\t\t\t</ul>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t</li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/biography/To=\nm-Uttech\">Biography</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/worksAva=\nilable/Tom-Uttech\">Works Available</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/a=\nrtists/worksExhibited/Tom-Uttech\">Works Exhibited</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<l=\ni><a href=3D\"/artists/press/Tom-Uttech\">Press</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a=\n href=3D\"/artists/essays/Tom-Uttech\">Essays &amp; Interviews</a></li>=0A\t\t\t=\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/exhibitions/Tom-Uttech\">Past Exhibitions</=\na></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</ul>=0A</div>\t</div>=0A\t</div>=0A<div id=3D'link'>=0A\t<=\na href=3D\"http://www.kyung.com\" target=3D\"_blank\" class=3D\"kyungLink\">Web d=\nesign by kyung.com</a></div>=0A<script type=3D\"text/javascript\">=0Avar gaJs=\nHost =3D ((\"https:\" =3D=3D document.location.protocol) ? \"https://ssl.\" :=\n=0A\"http://www.\");=0Adocument.write(unescape(\"%3Cscript src=3D'\" + gaJsHost=\n +=0A\"google-analytics.com/ga.js' type=3D'text/javascript'%3E%3C/script%3E\"=\n));=0A</script>=0A<script type=3D\"text/javascript\">=0Atry {=0Avar pageTrack=\ner =3D _gat._getTracker(\"UA-8410440-1\");=0ApageTracker._trackPageview();=0A=\n} catch(err) {}</script>=0A</body>=0A</html>=0A", "code": 200, "level": 2, "url": "http://alexandregallery.com/exhibitions/pressRelease/61", "text": "Press Release", "time": 0.2867870330810547, "redirect_urls": [], "headers": {"Content-Length": "2992", "Content-Encoding": "gzip", "Set-Cookie": "CAKEPHP=54d19aee69422555c7f4273c1d3ce32d; {"body": "<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC \"-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01//EN\"=0A\t \"http://www.w3.org/TR=\n/html4/strict.dtd\">=0A<head>=0A<meta name=3D\"keywords\" content=3D\"Neil Well=\niver, Lois Dodd, Brett Bigbee, Gregory Amenoff, Loren MacIver, Emily Nellig=\nan, Tom Uttech, Vincent Smith, Arthur Dove, Marsden Hartley, John Marin, Al=\nfred Maurer, Stuart Davis, Stieglitz, Anne Harris, Modernist, American Art\">=\n=0A<meta name=3D\"description\" content=3D\"ALEXANDRE GALLERY, NYC, 212-755-28=\n28, Contemporary American art and early 20th century American Modernists an=\nd Stieglitz Group\">=0A<meta name=3D\"verify-v1\" content=3D\"MA5XFwrfN0KkG3+UK=\n7p1WU8QgJeH51m0xmvW9PNd5Kg=3D\"/>\t=0A<meta http-equiv=3D\"Content-Type\" conte=\nnt=3D\"text/html; charset=3Dutf-8\" /> =0A<title>ALEXANDRE GALLERY | Tom Utte=\nch | Biography</title>=0A<link href=3D\"/favicon.ico\" type=3D\"image/x-icon\" =\nrel=3D\"icon\" /><link href=3D\"/favicon.ico\" type=3D\"image/x-icon\" rel=3D\"sho=\nrtcut icon\" /><link rel=3D\"stylesheet\" type=3D\"text/css\" href=3D\"/css/main.=\ncss\" /> =0A=0A<!--[if lte IE 6]>=0A<style type=3D\"text/css\" media=3D\"screen=\n\">=0A\t#wrapper {=0A\t\toverflow:visible;=0A\t}\t\t=0A</style>=0A<![endif]-->=0A=\n=0A<script type=3D\"text/javascript\" src=3D\"/js/artwork.js\"></script></head>=\n=0A<body>=0A<div id=3D'wrapper'>=0A\t<div id=3D\"header\">=0A\t\t<div id=3D\"tops=\npacer\">&nbsp;</div>=0A\t\t<a href=3D\"/pages\" class=3D\"logo\"><span>Home</span>=\n</a>\t\t<div id=3D'menu'>=0A\t\t\t<table class=3D'menu'>=0A\t\t\t\t<tr>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td w=\nidth=3D'122'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/exhibitions/current\">Current Exhibition</=\na>\t\t\t\t\t=0A\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-cir=\ncle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'141'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/exh=\nibitions/upcoming\">Upcoming Exhibitions</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'i=\nmg'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=\n=3D'111'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/exhibitions/past\">Past Exhibitions</a>\t\t\t\t\t</=\ntd>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\"=\n /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'105'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/artists\">Artists &am=\np; Work</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-ci=\nrcle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'173'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/ar=\ntists/americanModernists\">American Modernist Works</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td=\n class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t=\n\t\t<td width=3D'70'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/pages/contact\">Contact</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=\n=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" />=\n</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'60'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/artists/prints\">Prints</=\na>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t</tr>=0A\t\t\t</table>=0A\t\t</div>=0A\t</div>=0A\t<div id=3D'c=\nontent'>=0A\t\t\t\t<div class=3D'top-left-image'>=0A\t<a href=3D\"/artists/view/1=\n3\"><img src=3D\"/img/uploads/med_TU_Enassamiian.jpg\" class=3D\"floatLeft gold=\nbox\" alt=3D\"Enassamiian\" /></a></div>=0A<div class=3D'text'>=0A\t<span class=\n=3D'title'><a href=3D\"/artists/view/Tom-Uttech\">Tom Uttech</a> | Biography<=\n/span>\t<br><br>=0A\t<p>Tom Uttech | BIOGRAPHY<br /><br />&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;=\nOver the last decade, Tom Uttech has emerged as one of the most widely admi=\nred landscape painters in America. His enigmatic views, based on the verdan=\nt northern woods of the Precambrian Shield, have few parallels in contempor=\nary art.<br />&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;After finishing a degree at the Layton Sch=\nool of Art in Milwaukee, Uttech went to graduate school at the University o=\nf Cincinnati. He taught for a year at the Arkansas Art Center in Little Roc=\nk, and then a teaching position at the University of Wisconsin at Milwaukee=\n allowed him to return home. He was a professor of art at the University fr=\nom 1968 until his resignation in 1998.<br />&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;Since the 19=\n60&rsquo;s Uttech has made numerous camping and canoeing trips in the Queti=\nco Provincial Park in Ontario, Canada, and northern Minnesota. One aspect t=\nhat distinguishes Uttech&rsquo;s paintings from most contemporary landscape=\ns is that he does no drawings, studies, or photographs on these treks. They=\n are studio inventions based entirely on memory and improvisation.<br />&nb=\nsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;Over the years Uttech became increasingly dismayed with the=\n inappropriate frames put on his canvases. Remembering the beautiful hand-p=\nainted molding of Gallen-Kallela&rsquo;s Waterfall at Mantykoski, which he =\nhad seen in the Northern Light exhibition organized by the Brooklyn Museum =\nof Art in 1982, as well as colorful Scandinavian chests and furniture and h=\nis affection for the Pennsylvania Dutch art of Rosemaling, Uttech began mak=\ning and painting his frames. These wide, flat pine moldings are finished wi=\nth stains that range from clear to dark earth tones and are decorated with =\nan assortment of wildlife, foliage, pictographs, and mythological creatures=\n.<br />&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;As Tom Uttech has stated, &ldquo;The best respons=\ne to my paintings would be for you to march right out of the gallery and go=\n straight to the wildest piece of land you can find and sit down and let it=\n wash over you and tell you secrets.&rdquo;<br /><br />Taken from a text by=\n John Arthur. Published in, Tom Uttech: Mystical Landscapes, Leigh Yawkey W=\noodson Museum.<br /><br /><br />SELECTED SOLO EXHIBITIONS</p>=0D=0A<p>2012-=\n2013&nbsp; New Paintings, Alexandre Gallery, New York, New York</p>=0D=0A<p=\n>&nbsp;</p>=0D=0A<p>2012&nbsp; New Paintings, List Gallery, Swarthmore Coll=\nege, Swarthmore, Pennsylvania.</p>=0D=0A<p>&nbsp;</p>=0D=0A<p>2009 New Pain=\ntings, Alexandre Gallery, New York, New York.<br /><br />2006 Recent Painti=\nngs, Alexandre Gallery. New York, New York.<br /><br />2004 Photographs fro=\nm the 1970s, Alexandre Gallery, New York, New York.<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;=\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Magnetic North: The Landscapes of Tom Uttech, Milw=\naukee Art, Museum. Milwaukee,&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp=\n; &nbsp; &nbsp; Wisconsin.<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; =\nTom Uttech: New Paintings and Photographs, Tory Folliard Gallery,Milwaukee,=\n Wisconsin.<br /><br />2003 New Paintings, Alexandre Gallery. Chicago, Illinois.</p>=\n</div>=0A<div class=3D'goldbox'>=0A\t<ul>=0A\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/view=\n/Tom-Uttech\" class=3D\"title\">Tom Uttech</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li>Biogr=\naphy</li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/worksAvailable/Tom-Uttech\">=\nWorks Available</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/worksExhibit=\ned/Tom-Uttech\">Works Exhibited</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artis=\nts/press/Tom-Uttech\">Press</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/e=\nssays/Tom-Uttech\">Essays &amp; Interviews</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a hre=\nf=3D\"/artists/exhibitions/Tom-Uttech\">Past Exhibitions</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t=\n</ul>=0A</div>\t</div>=0A\t</div>=0A<div id=3D'link'>=0A\t<a href=3D\"http://ww=\nw.kyung.com\" target=3D\"_blank\" class=3D\"kyungLink\">Web design by kyung.com<=\n/a></div>=0A<script type=3D\"text/javascript\">=0Avar gaJsHost =3D ((\"https:\"=\n =3D=3D document.location.protocol) ? {"body": "<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC \"-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01//EN\"=0A\t \"http://www.w3.org/TR=\n/html4/strict.dtd\">=0A<head>=0A<meta name=3D\"keywords\" content=3D\"Neil Well=\niver, Lois Dodd, Brett Bigbee, Gregory Amenoff, Loren MacIver, Emily Nellig=\nan, Tom Uttech, Vincent Smith, Arthur Dove, Marsden Hartley, John Marin, Al=\nfred Maurer, Stuart Davis, Stieglitz, Anne Harris, Modernist, American Art\">=\n=0A<meta name=3D\"description\" content=3D\"ALEXANDRE GALLERY, NYC, 212-755-28=\n28, Contemporary American art and early 20th century American Modernists an=\nd Stieglitz Group\">=0A<meta name=3D\"verify-v1\" content=3D\"MA5XFwrfN0KkG3+UK=\n7p1WU8QgJeH51m0xmvW9PNd5Kg=3D\"/>\t=0A<meta http-equiv=3D\"Content-Type\" conte=\nnt=3D\"text/html; charset=3Dutf-8\" /> =0A<title>ALEXANDRE GALLERY | Anne Har=\nris | Recent Work | Press Release</title>=0A<link href=3D\"/favicon.ico\" typ=\ne=3D\"image/x-icon\" rel=3D\"icon\" /><link href=3D\"/favicon.ico\" type=3D\"image=\n/x-icon\" rel=3D\"shortcut icon\" /><link rel=3D\"stylesheet\" type=3D\"text/css\"=\n href=3D\"/css/main.css\" /> =0A=0A<!--[if lte IE 6]>=0A<style type=3D\"text/c=\nss\" media=3D\"screen\">=0A\t#wrapper {=0A\t\toverflow:visible;=0A\t}\t\t=0A</style>=\n=0A<![endif]-->=0A=0A<script type=3D\"text/javascript\" src=3D\"/js/artwork.js=\n\"></script></head>=0A<body>=0A<div id=3D'wrapper'>=0A\t<div id=3D\"header\">=\n=0A\t\t<div id=3D\"topspacer\">&nbsp;</div>=0A\t\t<a href=3D\"/pages\" class=3D\"log=\no\"><span>Home</span></a>\t\t<div id=3D'menu'>=0A\t\t\t<table class=3D'menu'>=0A\t=\n\t\t\t<tr>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'122'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/exhibitions/current\">=\nCurrent Exhibition</a>\t\t\t\t\t=0A\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=\n=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'141'>=0A=\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/exhibitions/upcoming\">Upcoming Exhibitions</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=\n=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" />=\n</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'111'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/exhibitions/past\">Past =\nExhibitions</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/=\nl-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'105'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D=\n\"/artists\">Artists &amp; Work</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img s=\nrc=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'173'>=\n=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/artists/americanModernists\">American Modernist Works</=\na>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\"=\n alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'70'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/pages/contac=\nt\">Contact</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l=\n-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'60'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/=\nartists/prints\">Prints</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t</tr>=0A\t\t\t</table>=0A\t\t</div>=\n=0A\t</div>=0A\t<div id=3D'content'>=0A\t\t\t\t<div class=3D'top-left-image'>=0A\t=\n<a href=3D\"/exhibitions/view/16\"><img src=3D\"/img/uploads/med_AH07.01_Angel=\n0.jpg\" class=3D\"floatLeft goldbox\" alt=3D\"Angel\" /></a></div>=0A<div class=\n=3D'text'>=0A\t<span class=3D'title'><a href=3D\"/artists/view/6\">Anne Harris=\n</a> | \t<a href=3D\"/exhibitions/view/16\">Recent Work</a> | Press Release</s=\npan>=0A\t<br><br>=0A\t<span class=3D'bold'>=0A\tAnne Harris | \tRecent Work</sp=\nan><br>=0A\t\tExtended through January 12, 2008<br>\t<br>=0A\t<p align=3D\"cente=\nr\"><strong>The Review Panel will discuss Anne Harris&rsquo;s work on Friday=\n, December 14 at 6:45 PM at the National Academy Museum, 1083 Fifth Avenue =\nat 89<sup>th</sup> Street.&nbsp; Hosted by the National Academy Museum and =\nartcritical.com</strong></p>=0D=0A<p align=3D\"center\"><strong><br /></stron=\ng></p>=0D=0A<p>The gallery is pleased to present an exhibition of new paint=\nings and drawings by Anne Harris.&nbsp; This show will include two new pain=\ntings and six works on paper.&nbsp;This will be the gallery&rsquo;s first s=\nhow of Harris&rsquo;s work.&nbsp;<br /> <br /> Some of Harris&rsquo;s most =\narresting work has been self-portraiture.&nbsp; In this show she renews tha=\nt exploration, this time focusing on the effects of gravity on the body. Th=\ne downward pull of flesh that comes with ageing is emphasized in these work=\ns, in which the figure often gazes down.&nbsp; Harris has never been one fo=\nr flattery and in many ways she paints herself at her unflinching worst.&nb=\nsp; In this scrutinizing mode she finds her veiny, fleshy, overripe and sla=\nckening body tempered with subtle fragility.<br /> <br /> At the same time =\nthere is a strange beauty present, achieved through labored formal means.&n=\nbsp; Layers of translucent paint become glowing diffused flesh on atmospher=\nic monochrome backgrounds (suggesting a sort of nether world).&nbsp; There =\nis a back and forth between the process driven, labor-intensive building an=\nd the anxiety filled intensity of the gaze which freezes the moment in time=\n.&nbsp; This duality has the effect of speeding up and slowing down time.<b=\nr /> <br /> Curator Allison Ferris wrote in her 2003 essay <em>Without Like=\nness</em>, &ldquo;The pellucid skin of her shoulders, arms, hands, and thig=\nhs recedes into the background of the paintings.&nbsp; The diffusive backgr=\nound, in turn, is skin-like and joins almost seamlessly with her body.&nbsp=\n; The ambiguous boundaries between the subject and the background suggest t=\nhat the qualities of Harris&rsquo;s body extend to the whole canvas.&nbsp; =\nHer body is, in a sense, the painting.&rdquo;<br /> <br /> Anne Harris (b. =\n1961) received an MFA from Yale.&nbsp; Her work has been exhibited at Bowdo=\nin College Museum of Art, Portland Museum of Art and The Aldrich Museum of =\nContemporary Art.&nbsp; She is the recipient of the John Simon Guggenheim M=\nemorial Foundation Fellowship and the National Endowment for the Arts.&nbsp=\n; Her work is in the collections of Arkansas Art Center, Fogg Art Museum an=\nd the New York Public Library.</p></div>=0A<div class=3D'goldbox'>=0A\t<ul>=\n=0A\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/view/Anne-Harris\" class=3D\"title\">Anne Harri=\ns</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/exhibitions/view/16\"><span class=3D'tit=\nle'>Recent Work</span><br>December 14, 2007 through January 12, 2008</a>\t\t\t=\n\t\t\t\t<ul>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li>Press Release</li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</ul>=0A\t\t\t\t=\n\t\t</li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/biography/Anne-Harris\">Biogr=\naphy</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/worksAvailable/Anne-Har=\nris\">Works Available</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/worksEx=\nhibited/Anne-Harris\">Works Exhibited</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"=\n/artists/press/Anne-Harris\">Press</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/ar=\ntists/essays/Anne-Harris\">Essays &amp; Interviews</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<l=\ni><a href=3D\"/artists/exhibitions/Anne-Harris\">Past Exhibitions</a></li>=0A=\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</ul>=0A</div>\t</div>=0A\t</div>=0A<div id=3D'link'>=0A\t<a href=3D\"=\nhttp://www.kyung.com\" target=3D\"_blank\" class=3D\"kyungLink\">Web design by k=\nyung.com</a></div>=0A<script type=3D\"text/javascript\">=0Avar gaJsHost =3D (=\n(\"https:\" =3D=3D document.location.protocol) ? \"https://ssl.\" :=0A\"http://w=\nww.\");=0Adocument.write(unescape(\"%3Cscript src=3D'\" + gaJsHost +=0A\"google=\n-analytics.com/ga.js' type=3D'text/javascript'%3E%3C/script%3E\"));=0A</scri=\npt>=0A<script type=3D\"text/javascript\">=0Atry {=0Avar pageTracker =3D _gat.=\n_getTracker(\"UA-8410440-1\");=0ApageTracker._trackPageview();=0A} catch(err)=\n {}</script>=0A</body>=0A</html>=0A", "code": 200, "level": 2, "url": "http://alexandregallery.com/exhibitions/pressRelease/16", "text": "Press Release", "time": 0.7269840240478516, "redirect_urls": [], "headers": {"Content-Length": "2825", "Content-Encoding": "gzip", "Set-Cookie": "CAKEPHP=83441887fecd65b6966022e7ed42e939; {"body": "<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC \"-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01//EN\"=0A\t \"http://www.w3.org/TR=\n/html4/strict.dtd\">=0A<head>=0A<meta name=3D\"keywords\" content=3D\"Neil Well=\niver, Lois Dodd, Brett Bigbee, Gregory Amenoff, Loren MacIver, Emily Nellig=\nan, Tom Uttech, Vincent Smith, Arthur Dove, Marsden Hartley, John Marin, Al=\nfred Maurer, Stuart Davis, Stieglitz, Anne Harris, Modernist, American Art\">=\n=0A<meta name=3D\"description\" content=3D\"ALEXANDRE GALLERY, NYC, 212-755-28=\n28, Contemporary American art and early 20th century American Modernists an=\nd Stieglitz Group\">=0A<meta name=3D\"verify-v1\" content=3D\"MA5XFwrfN0KkG3+UK=\n7p1WU8QgJeH51m0xmvW9PNd5Kg=3D\"/>\t=0A<meta http-equiv=3D\"Content-Type\" conte=\nnt=3D\"text/html; {"body": "<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC \"-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01//EN\"=0A\t \"http://www.w3.org/TR=\n/html4/strict.dtd\">=0A<head>=0A<meta name=3D\"keywords\" content=3D\"Neil Well=\niver, Lois Dodd, Brett Bigbee, Gregory Amenoff, Loren MacIver, Emily Nellig=\nan, Tom Uttech, Vincent Smith, Arthur Dove, Marsden Hartley, John Marin, Al=\nfred Maurer, Stuart Davis, Stieglitz, Anne Harris, Modernist, American Art\">=\n=0A<meta name=3D\"description\" content=3D\"ALEXANDRE GALLERY, NYC, 212-755-28=\n28, Contemporary American art and early 20th century American Modernists an=\nd Stieglitz Group\">=0A<meta name=3D\"verify-v1\" content=3D\"MA5XFwrfN0KkG3+UK=\n7p1WU8QgJeH51m0xmvW9PNd5Kg=3D\"/>\t=0A<meta http-equiv=3D\"Content-Type\" conte=\nnt=3D\"text/html; charset=3Dutf-8\" /> =0A<title>ALEXANDRE GALLERY | Vincent =\nSmith | Early Paintings and Drawings | Press Release</title>=0A<link href=\n=3D\"/favicon.ico\" type=3D\"image/x-icon\" rel=3D\"icon\" /><link href=3D\"/favic=\non.ico\" type=3D\"image/x-icon\" rel=3D\"shortcut icon\" /><link rel=3D\"styleshe=\net\" type=3D\"text/css\" href=3D\"/css/main.css\" /> =0A=0A<!--[if lte IE 6]>=0A=\n<style type=3D\"text/css\" media=3D\"screen\">=0A\t#wrapper {=0A\t\toverflow:visib=\nle;=0A\t}\t\t=0A</style>=0A<![endif]-->=0A=0A<script type=3D\"text/javascript\" =\nsrc=3D\"/js/artwork.js\"></script></head>=0A<body>=0A<div id=3D'wrapper'>=0A\t=\n<div id=3D\"header\">=0A\t\t<div id=3D\"topspacer\">&nbsp;</div>=0A\t\t<a href=3D\"/=\npages\" class=3D\"logo\"><span>Home</span></a>\t\t<div id=3D'menu'>=0A\t\t\t<table =\nclass=3D'menu'>=0A\t\t\t\t<tr>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'122'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/ex=\nhibitions/current\">Current Exhibition</a>\t\t\t\t\t=0A\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td clas=\ns=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td=\n width=3D'141'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/exhibitions/upcoming\">Upcoming Exhibiti=\nons</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle=\n.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'111'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/exhibi=\ntions/past\">Past Exhibitions</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img sr=\nc=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'105'>=\n=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/artists\">Artists &amp; Work</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td c=\nlass=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t=\n<td width=3D'173'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/artists/americanModernists\">American=\n Modernist Works</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/as=\nsets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'70'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a hre=\nf=3D\"/pages/contact\">Contact</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img sr=\nc=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'60'>=0A=\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/artists/prints\">Prints</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t</tr>=0A\t\t\t</t=\nable>=0A\t\t</div>=0A\t</div>=0A\t<div id=3D'content'>=0A\t\t\t\t<div class=3D'top-=\nleft-image'>=0A\t<a href=3D\"/exhibitions/view/21\"><img src=3D\"/img/uploads/m=\ned_VS64_ForMyPeople.jpg\" class=3D\"floatLeft goldbox\" alt=3D\"For My People\" =\n/></a></div>=0A<div class=3D'text'>=0A\t<span class=3D'title'><a href=3D\"/ar=\ntists/view/12\">Vincent Smith</a> | \t<a href=3D\"/exhibitions/view/21\">Early =\nPaintings and Drawings</a> | Press Release</span>=0A\t<br><br>=0A\t<span clas=\ns=3D'bold'>=0A\tVincent Smith | \tEarly Paintings and Drawings</span><br>=0A\t=\n\tJanuary 4 through January 29, 2005<br>\t<br>=0A\t<p><span style=3D\"font-fami=\nly: Arial,Helvetica,Geneva,Swiss,SunSans-Regular;\">Early Work<br /> <br /> =\nA memorial service to honor Vincent Smith&rsquo;s life will be held at the =\nHenry Street Settlement on January 8 at 3 pm.<br /> <br /> The gallery is p=\nleased to announce an exhibition of Vincent Smith&rsquo;s early paintings a=\nnd works on paper from the 1950s and 60s. Included are examples from the se=\nldom seen Saturday Night in Harlem series created during the mid-1950s.<br =\n/> <br /> During this period Vincent Smith was an artist who pursued social=\n inquiry that articulated African-American identity. Along with contemporar=\nies such as his close friend Jacob Lawrence, Smith used the communicative m=\nedium of painting in a direct, raw, colorful and narrative style to represe=\nnt contemporary social issues, such as police brutality and political strug=\ngles. A parallel path in Smith&rsquo;s work investigates a more quotidian e=\nxperience such as everyday New York street life, which served as a fertile =\nsource of inspiration. Typically the rich details of placards on stores and=\n buildings, the assembled people and their humanity mirror the ethos of the=\n time.<br /> <br /> In drawings like \"The Murder of Fred Hampton\" Smith por=\ntrayed the assassinated Black Panther Party leader. The body of Hampton lie=\ns at the bottom of the composition amid bullet holes and sanguine splashes,=\n with the specifics of the scene roughly drawn in &ndash; the spontaneity o=\nf the drawing creating an emotional charge.<br /> <br /> Smith was born in =\nNew York in 1929 and died in 2004. In the 1950s he studied at the Art Stude=\nnts League, the Brooklyn Museum Art School and the Skowhegan School of Pain=\nting and Sculpture. On the occasion of the gallery&rsquo;s 2003 exhibition =\nof Smith&rsquo;s work Holland Cotter wrote that a persuasive case can be ma=\nde &ldquo;for the inclusion of his best work in any serious account of post=\nwar 20th century American art.&rdquo;<br /></span></p></div>=0A<div class=\n=3D'goldbox'>=0A\t<ul>=0A\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/view/Vincent-Smith\" cla=\nss=3D\"title\">Vincent Smith</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/exhibitions/vi=\new/21\"><span class=3D'title'>Early Paintings and Drawings</span><br>January=\n 4 through January 29, 2005</a>\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<ul>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li>Press Releas=\ne</li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/exhibitions/press/21\">Press</a>=\n</li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</ul>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t</li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/art=\nists/biography/Vincent-Smith\">Biography</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=\n=3D\"/artists/worksAvailable/Vincent-Smith\">Works Available</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t=\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/worksExhibited/Vincent-Smith\">Works Exhibite=\nd</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/press/Vincent-Smith\">Press=\n</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/essays/Vincent-Smith\">Essay=\ns &amp; Interviews</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/exhibitio=\nns/Vincent-Smith\">Past Exhibitions</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</ul>=0A</div>\t</div>=\n=0A\t</div>=0A<div id=3D'link'>=0A\t<a href=3D\"http://www.kyung.com\" target=\n=3D\"_blank\" class=3D\"kyungLink\">Web design by kyung.com</a></div>=0A<script=\n type=3D\"text/javascript\">=0Avar gaJsHost =3D ((\"https:\" =3D=3D document.lo=\ncation.protocol) ? {"body": "<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC \"-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01//EN\"=0A\t \"http://www.w3.org/TR=\n/html4/strict.dtd\">=0A<head>=0A<meta name=3D\"keywords\" content=3D\"Neil Well=\niver, Lois Dodd, Brett Bigbee, Gregory Amenoff, Loren MacIver, Emily Nellig=\nan, Tom Uttech, Vincent Smith, Arthur Dove, Marsden Hartley, John Marin, Al=\nfred Maurer, Stuart Davis, Stieglitz, Anne Harris, Modernist, American Art\">=\n=0A<meta name=3D\"description\" content=3D\"ALEXANDRE GALLERY, NYC, 212-755-28=\n28, Contemporary American art and early 20th century American Modernists an=\nd Stieglitz Group\">=0A<meta name=3D\"verify-v1\" content=3D\"MA5XFwrfN0KkG3+UK=\n7p1WU8QgJeH51m0xmvW9PNd5Kg=3D\"/>\t=0A<meta http-equiv=3D\"Content-Type\" conte=\nnt=3D\"text/html; Work</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D=\n'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td wid=\nth=3D'173'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/artists/americanModernists\">American Modern=\nist Works</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-=\ncircle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'70'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/p=\nages/contact\">Contact</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/i=\nmg/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'60'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<=\na href=3D\"/artists/prints\">Prints</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t</tr>=0A\t\t\t</table>=\n=0A\t\t</div>=0A\t</div>=0A\t<div id=3D'content'>=0A\t\t\t\t<div class=3D'top-left-=\nimage'>=0A\t<a href=3D\"/exhibitions/view/19\"><img src=3D\"/img/uploads/med_LM=\n485TownFlowers.jpg\" class=3D\"floatLeft goldbox\" alt=3D\"Town Flowers\" /></a>=\n</div>=0A<div class=3D'text'>=0A\t<span class=3D'title'><a href=3D\"/artists/=\nview/10\">Loren MacIver</a> | \t<a href=3D\"/exhibitions/view/19\">The Poetry o=\nf Objects</a> | Press Release</span>=0A\t<br><br>=0A\t<span class=3D'bold'>=\n=0A\tLoren MacIver | \tThe Poetry of Objects</span><br>=0A\t\tJanuary 18 throug=\nh February 29, 2008<br>\t<br>=0A\t<div></div>=0D=0A<p>The gallery is pleased =\nto announce <em>Loren MacIver: The Poetry of Objects</em>, a surveyexhibiti=\non of paintings and drawings dating from 1935 through the early 1980s, span=\nning theartist&rsquo;s career.&nbsp; The show will include thirteen paintin=\ngs and a selection of works on paper.<br /> <br /> The title refers to MacI=\nver&rsquo;s frequent depiction of objects from her quotidian surroundings, =\nboth in New York and in France.&nbsp; From Elizabeth Bishop&rsquo;s rosary =\nto Etruscan vases at the Metropolitan or objects on a fire escape, these wo=\nrks describe ephemera and bibelots of daily life. The intensity of MacIver&=\nrsquo;s focus on sensuous fleeting objects keeps them in the world.&nbsp; H=\ner interest is in the tenuous, transparent, and the easily overlooked.&nbsp=\n;&nbsp; Often the objects take on a form of hieroglyph, as in <em>Patisseri=\ne,</em> where rows of abstracted pastries become symbolic.&nbsp; Her images=\n are created in a soft, glowing light and often have the quality of being l=\nit from within.&nbsp; Her use of pale washes of color, delicate line, all-o=\nver composition, and semi-abstraction work toward her goal &ldquo;to make s=\nomething permanent out of the transitory.&rdquo;<br /> <br /> Poets were an=\n integral part of MacIver&rsquo;s social milieu.&nbsp; She was married to L=\nloyd Frankenberg and was life-long friends with Elizabeth Bishop, Marianne =\nMoore, e.e. cummings and Dylan Thomas.&nbsp; Her paintings have few direct =\ncorollaries to their work, though a record exists through correspondence.&n=\nbsp; Marianne Moore responded to MacIver&rsquo;s first exhibition at Pierre=\n Matisse Gallery in 1940 by writing &ldquo;restrained, unagressively concea=\nled almost, but unmistakable poems.&rdquo;&nbsp; Curator Debra Bricker Balk=\nen writes,<br /> <br /> &nbsp;. . .that Moore read paintings such as <em>Et=\nruscan Vases, Case No. 40</em> as a &lsquo;poem&rsquo; reinforces the lyric=\nal content of MacIver&rsquo;s work, while establishing a parallel or connec=\ntion to poetry.&nbsp; Certain structural similarities exist in the reduced =\nor &lsquo;restrained&rsquo; configuration of <em>Etruscan Vases, Case No. 4=\n0</em> and the ensuing <em>Votive Light Series</em>, and the terse format o=\nf the poem, both these kind of analogies remain, again, generalized, operat=\ning more as a point of comparison than a specific reference or influence.&n=\nbsp; The distillation of essentially transcendent subject matter&mdash;the =\nmagic and illusory nature of light&mdash;into the medium of painting merge =\nas the &lsquo;visual poetics&rsquo; of MacIver&rsquo;s work.&rdquo;<br /> <=\nbr /> Highlights of MacIver&rsquo;s biography include the 1946 landmark exh=\nibition <em>Fourteen Americans</em> organized by Dorothy Miller at the Muse=\num of Modern Art.&nbsp; The Whitney Museum presented a retrospective of her=\n work in 1953.&nbsp; In 1962 her work represented the United States at the =\n31<sup>st</sup> Venice Biennale.&nbsp; She was represented by Pierre Matiss=\ne Gallery for fifty years.&nbsp; In 1989 she was awarded the first Lee Kras=\nner Award from the Pollock-Krasner Foundation.&nbsp; Her work is included i=\nn major public collections such as The Art Institute of Chicago, Metropolit=\nan Museum of Art, Museum of Modern Art, The Phillips Collection and Whitney=\n Museum of American Art.</p></div>=0A<div class=3D'goldbox'>=0A\t<ul>=0A\t\t\t\t=\n<li><a href=3D\"/artists/view/Loren-MacIver\" class=3D\"title\">Loren MacIver</=\na></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/exhibitions/view/19\"><span class=3D'title'=\n>The Poetry of Objects</span><br>January 18 through February 29, 2008</a>\t\t=\n\t\t\t\t\t<ul>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li>Press Release</li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</ul>=0A\t\t\t=\n\t\t\t</li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/biography/Loren-MacIver\">Bi=\nography</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/worksAvailable/Loren=\n-MacIver\">Works Available</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/wo=\nrksExhibited/Loren-MacIver\">Works Exhibited</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a h=\nref=3D\"/artists/press/Loren-MacIver\">Press</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a hr=\nef=3D\"/artists/essays/Loren-MacIver\">Essays &amp; Interviews</a></li>=0A\t\t\t=\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/exhibitions/Loren-MacIver\">Past Exhibition=\ns</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</ul>=0A</div>\t</div>=0A\t</div>=0A<div id=3D'link'>=\n=0A\t<a href=3D\"http://www.kyung.com\" target=3D\"_blank\" class=3D\"kyungLink\">=\nWeb design by kyung.com</a></div>=0A<script type=3D\"text/javascript\">=0Avar=\n gaJsHost =3D ((\"https:\" =3D=3D document.location.protocol) ? \"https://ssl.=\n\" :=0A\"http://www.\");=0Adocument.write(unescape(\"%3Cscript src=3D'\" + gaJsH=\nost +=0A\"google-analytics.com/ga.js' type=3D'text/javascript'%3E%3C/script%=\n3E\"));=0A</script>=0A<script type=3D\"text/javascript\">=0Atry {=0Avar pageTr=\nacker =3D _gat._getTracker(\"UA-8410440-1\");=0ApageTracker._trackPageview();=\n=0A} catch(err) {}</script>=0A</body>=0A</html>=0A", "code": 200, "level": 2, "url": "http://alexandregallery.com/exhibitions/pressRelease/19", "text": "Press Release", "time": 0.24907493591308594, "redirect_urls": [], "headers": {"Content-Length": "3157", "Content-Encoding": "gzip", "Set-Cookie": "CAKEPHP=e36a8654c09b3b927665d97cbf8cef24; {"body": "<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC \"-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01//EN\"=0A\t \"http://www.w3.org/TR=\n/html4/strict.dtd\">=0A<head>=0A<meta name=3D\"keywords\" content=3D\"Neil Well=\niver, Lois Dodd, Brett Bigbee, Gregory Amenoff, Loren MacIver, Emily Nellig=\nan, Tom Uttech, Vincent Smith, Arthur Dove, Marsden Hartley, John Marin, Al=\nfred Maurer, Stuart Davis, Stieglitz, Anne Harris, Modernist, American Art\">=\n=0A<meta name=3D\"description\" content=3D\"ALEXANDRE GALLERY, NYC, 212-755-28=\n28, Contemporary American art and early 20th century American Modernists an=\nd Stieglitz Group\">=0A<meta name=3D\"verify-v1\" content=3D\"MA5XFwrfN0KkG3+UK=\n7p1WU8QgJeH51m0xmvW9PNd5Kg=3D\"/>\t=0A<meta http-equiv=3D\"Content-Type\" conte=\nnt=3D\"text/html; charset=3Dutf-8\" /> =0A<title>ALEXANDRE GALLERY | Loren Ma=\ncIver | Biography</title>=0A<link href=3D\"/favicon.ico\" type=3D\"image/x-ico=\nn\" rel=3D\"icon\" /><link href=3D\"/favicon.ico\" type=3D\"image/x-icon\" rel=3D\"=\nshortcut icon\" /><link rel=3D\"stylesheet\" type=3D\"text/css\" href=3D\"/css/ma=\nin.css\" /> =0A=0A<!--[if lte IE 6]>=0A<style type=3D\"text/css\" media=3D\"scr=\neen\">=0A\t#wrapper {=0A\t\toverflow:visible;=0A\t}\t\t=0A</style>=0A<![endif]-->=\n=0A=0A<script type=3D\"text/javascript\" src=3D\"/js/artwork.js\"></script></he=\nad>=0A<body>=0A<div id=3D'wrapper'>=0A\t<div id=3D\"header\">=0A\t\t<div id=3D\"t=\nopspacer\">&nbsp;</div>=0A\t\t<a href=3D\"/pages\" class=3D\"logo\"><span>Home</sp=\nan></a>\t\t<div id=3D'menu'>=0A\t\t\t<table class=3D'menu'>=0A\t\t\t\t<tr>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<t=\nd width=3D'122'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/exhibitions/current\">Current Exhibitio=\nn</a>\t\t\t\t\t=0A\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-=\ncircle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'141'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/=\nexhibitions/upcoming\">Upcoming Exhibitions</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=\n=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td =\nwidth=3D'111'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/exhibitions/past\">Past Exhibitions</a>\t\t=\n\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=\n=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'105'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/artists\">Artist=\ns &amp; Work</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets=\n/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'173'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=\n=3D\"/artists/americanModernists\">American Modernist Works</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t=\n\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=\n=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'70'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/pages/contact\">Contact</a>\t\t\t=\n\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=\n=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'60'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/artists/prints\">=\nPrints</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t</tr>=0A\t\t\t</table>=0A\t\t</div>=0A\t</div>=0A\t<div=\n id=3D'content'>=0A\t\t\t\t<div class=3D'top-left-image'>=0A\t<a href=3D\"/artist=\ns/view/10\"><img src=3D\"/img/uploads/med_LM568_Geranium_low.jpg\" class=3D\"fl=\noatLeft goldbox\" alt=3D\"Geranium\" /></a></div>=0A<div class=3D'text'>=0A\t<s=\npan class=3D'title'><a href=3D\"/artists/view/Loren-MacIver\">Loren MacIver</=\na> | Biography</span>\t<br><br>=0A\t<p><span style=3D\"font-family: Arial,Helv=\netica,Geneva,Swiss,SunSans-Regular;\">Chronology<br /> <br /> 1909: February=\n 2, born New York City, daughter of Charles Augustus Paul Newman, a doctor,=\n and Julia (MacIver) Newman, a librarian. Mother, of Scottish-Irish descent=\n, retained maiden name which Loren adopted.<br /> <br /> 1919:\tStudies at A=\nrts Students League, New York, Saturday Classes, for one year.<br /> <br />=\n 1929: Marries poet and critic Lloyd Frankenberg. Couple moves to Greenwich=\n Village. Their second home on MacDougal Street is subject of Strunsky Hous=\ne, 1935 <br /> <br /> 1931:\tFirst of ten consecutive summers spent on Cape =\nCod.<br /> <br /> 1935: First museum purchase, Shack, 1934, by Alfred Baar =\nfor Museum of Modern Art (accessioned 1938). Baar also acquires work for hi=\ns own collection.<br /> <br /> 1936:\tReceives Federal Arts Project assignme=\nnt; remains member until 1940.<br /> <br /> 1938: First one-person exhibiti=\non at Marian Willard&rsquo;s East River Gallery. Catalogue statements writt=\nen by John Erskine, John B. Flannagan, Morris Kantor and Holger Cahill.<br =\n/> <br /> 1938:\tSpends winter in Key West, Florida.<br /> <br /> 1940:\tPier=\nre Matisse Gallery&rsquo;s first exhibition of MacIver&rsquo;s work.  Matis=\nse remains \ther dealer until 1990.<br /> <br /> 1941: Designs backdrops and=\n lighting for Museum of Modern Art Coffee Concerts at invitation of Louise =\nCrane. MacIver previously designed lighting for Virgil Thompson&rsquo;s Fou=\nr Saints in Three Acts.<br /> <br /> 1945:\tFirst one-person museum exhibiti=\non at Baltimore Museum of Art.<br /> <br /> 1946: Dorothy C. Miller include=\ns MacIver&rsquo;s work in Museum of Modern Art exhibition &ldquo;Fourteen A=\nmericans;&rdquo; travels to five venues.<br /> <br /> 1948: MacIver and Fra=\nnkenberg travel to France, Italy, England, Ireland and Scotland. (Subsequen=\nt European trip made in 1954. Couple lives in France between 1961-64 and 19=\n66-70).<br /> <br /> 1953: Whitney Museum of American Art organizes retrosp=\nective covering 20 years of work; venues include Dallas Museum of Art, San =\nFrancisco Museum of Art and Des Moins Art Center.</span></p>=0D=0A<p><span =\nstyle=3D\"font-family: Arial,Helvetica,Geneva,Swiss,SunSans-Regular;\"><br />=\n</span></p>=0D=0A<p><span style=3D\"font-family: Arial,Helvetica,Geneva,Swis=\ns,SunSans-Regular;\">1957:\tReceives first prize in Corcoran Biennial.<br /> =\n<br /> 1959:\tAmerican Academy of Arts and Letters elects MacIver as member.=\n<br /> <br /> 1960:\tReceives Ford Foundation Grant.<br /> <br /> 1962: Muse=\num of Modern Art selects MacIver to exhibit 25 paintings in American Pavili=\non at the XXXI Biennale, Venice. Art Institute of Chicago awards Frank G. L=\nogan Medal.<br /> <br /> 1963:\tReceives Urbana Purchase Prize, Krannert Art=\n Museum.<br /> <br /> 1965:\tThe Phillips Collection organizes its second on=\ne-person exhibition of MacIver&rsquo;s \twork.<br /> <br /> 1966: Maintains =\na studio in Paris at Spends the first of four summers in Provenance, first =\nat La Citadelle in Menerbes, home of John Rewald, and later in Le Castellet=\n, Var.<br /> <br /> 1968: Musee des Beaux Arts, Lyons organizes exhibition =\nHommage a Loren MacIver; additional venues include Musee d&rsquo;Art Modern=\ne, Paris.<br /> <br /> 1972:\tReceives Rothko Foundation Award.<br /> <br />=\n 1975:\tMontclair Museum of Art organizes retrospective exhibition.  MacIver=\n&rsquo;s husband \tLloyd Frankenberg dies.<br /> <br /> 1983:\tNewport Harbor=\n Art Museum (Orange County Museum of Art) organizes \tretrospective exhibiti=\non.<br /> <br /> 1985:\tReceives Francis Greenberger Award.<br /> <br /> 198=\n9:\tReceives first Lee Krasner Award, Pollock-Krasner Foundation.<br /> <br =\n/> 1992:\tMetropolitan Museum of Art acquires nine paintings by MacIver.<br =\n/> <br /> 1998:\tMacIver continues to live and work in Greenwich Village in =\nhouse Frankenberg <br /> and she purchased in the late 1940s.<br /> <br /> =\n1998:\tMay 3 MacIver dies peacefully at her home, 61 Perry Street, in Greenw=\nich <br /> Village, New York.</span></p>=0D=0A<p><span style=3D\"font-family=\n: Arial,Helvetica,Geneva,Swiss,SunSans-Regular;\"><br /></span></p>=0D=0A<p>=\n<span style=3D\"font-family: Arial,Helvetica,Geneva,Swiss,SunSans-Regular;\">=\n<strong>SELECTED PUBLIC COLLECTIONS</strong><br /> <br /> Addison Gallery o=\nf American Art, Andover, Massachusetts<br /> Art Institute of Chicago, Chic=\nago, Illinois<br /> Art Museum, Princeton University, Princeton, New Jersey=\n<br /> Baltimore Museum of Art, Baltimore, Maryland<br /> Bibliotheque Nati=\nonale, Paris, France<br /> Brooklyn Museum of Art, Brooklyn, New York<br />=\n Corcoran Gallery of Art, Washington, D. C.<br /> Hirshhorn Museum and Scul=\npture Garden, Washington, D. C.<br /> Francis Lehman Loeb Art Center, Pough=\nkeepsie, New York<br /> Los Angeles County Museum of Art, Los Angeles, Cali=\nfornia<br /> The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York, New York<br /> Museu=\nm of Contemporary Art, Chicago, Illinois<br /> The Museum of Modern Art, Ne=\nw York, New York<br /> National Gallery of Art, Washington, D. C.<br /> Neu=\nberger Museum of Art, Purchase, New York<br /> Newark Museum, Newark, New J=\nersey<br /> Philadelphia Museum of Art, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania<br /> Th=\ne Phillips Collection, Washington, D. C. <br /> San Francisco Museum of Mod=\nern Art, San Francisco, California<br /> Wadsworth Atheneum, Hartford, Conn=\necticut<br /> Walker Art Center, Minneapolis, Minnesota<br /> Whitney Museu=\nm of American Art, New York, New York<br /> Yale University Art Gallery, Ne=\nw Haven, Connecticut</span></p></div>=0A<div class=3D'goldbox'>=0A\t<ul>=0A\t=\n\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/view/Loren-MacIver\" class=3D\"title\">Loren MacIve=\nr</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li>Biography</li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D=\n\"/artists/worksAvailable/Loren-MacIver\">Works Available</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t=\n\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/worksExhibited/Loren-MacIver\">Works Exhibited</=\na></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/press/Loren-MacIver\">Press</a=\n></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/essays/Loren-MacIver\">Essays &=\namp; Interviews</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/exhibitions/=\nLoren-MacIver\">Past Exhibitions</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</ul>=0A</div>\t</div>=\n=0A\t</div>=0A<div id=3D'link'>=0A\t<a href=3D\"http://www.kyung.com\" target=\n=3D\"_blank\" class=3D\"kyungLink\">Web design by kyung.com</a></div>=0A<script=\n type=3D\"text/javascript\">=0Avar gaJsHost =3D ((\"https:\" =3D=3D document.lo=\ncation.protocol) ? Included will be three =\nlarge-scale figurative oil paintings, small-scale still-life paintings and =\nrelated drawings, both developmental and fully realized. &nbsp;His most rec=\nent painting, <em>Abby </em>(2005 &ndash; 2010), depicts a pre-teen girl cl=\nad in a brightly-colored flowered swimsuit emerging from a landscape of dir=\nt and leafy groundcover. The exhibition will include loans from private and=\n museum collections and will be accompanied by a fully illustrated catalogu=\ne with text by John Yau.<br /> &nbsp;<br /> Bigbee&rsquo;s highly detailed =\nand refined realism results in works of arresting psychological intensity a=\nnd sensitivity that break free of the clich&eacute;s and sentimentality too=\n often associated with the genre. &nbsp;Yau writes: &nbsp;<em>&ldquo;Workin=\ng on a painting, often for years, Bigbee always places his labor-intensive =\nprocess at the service of the particularizing expression, at once direct an=\nd elusive, relaxed and introspective, open to the world and yet separate fr=\nom it.&rdquo;</em> &nbsp;And speaking to the near metaphysical effect, Yau =\ncontinues: &nbsp;&ldquo;<em>Stillness and change lie at the heart of the ar=\ntist&rsquo;s portraits: &nbsp;the aching desire to slow down time is spelle=\nd out in carefully effaced brushstrokes, which literally and figuratively c=\naress each surface and trace each contour. &nbsp;Bigbee&rsquo;s labor &ndas=\nh; an act of devotion &ndash; is essential to the meaning of his work.&rdqu=\no;<br /> </em> <br /> This exhibition marks the first New York showing of t=\nhe Bigbee&rsquo;s work since 2003. <br /> &nbsp;</span></span></p></div>=0A=\n<div class=3D'goldbox'>=0A\t<ul>=0A\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/view/Brett-Bi=\ngbee\" class=3D\"title\">Brett Bigbee</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/exhibi=\ntions/view/76\"><span class=3D'title'>Recent Work</span><br>October 20 throu=\ngh December 17, 2011</a>\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<ul>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li>Press Release</li>=\n=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/exhibitions/press/76\">Press</a></li>=\n=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</ul>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t</li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/=\nbiography/Brett-Bigbee\">Biography</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/ar=\ntists/worksAvailable/Brett-Bigbee\">Works Available</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<=\nli><a href=3D\"/artists/worksExhibited/Brett-Bigbee\">Works Exhibited</a></li>=\n=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/viewPrints/Brett-Bigbee\">Prints</a><=\n/li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/press/Brett-Bigbee\">Press</a></l=\ni>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/essays/Brett-Bigbee\">Essays &amp; =\nInterviews</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/exhibitions/Brett=\n-Bigbee\">Past Exhibitions</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</ul>=0A</div>\t</div>=0A\t</di=\nv>=0A<div id=3D'link'>=0A\t<a href=3D\"http://www.kyung.com\" target=3D\"_blank=\n\" class=3D\"kyungLink\">Web design by kyung.com</a></div>=0A<script type=3D\"t=\next/javascript\">=0Avar gaJsHost =3D ((\"https:\" =3D=3D document.location.pro=\ntocol) ? \"https://ssl.\" :=0A\"http://www.\");=0Adocument.write(unescape(\"%3Cs=\ncript src=3D'\" + gaJsHost +=0A\"google-analytics.com/ga.js' type=3D'text/jav=\nascript'%3E%3C/script%3E\"));=0A</script>=0A<script type=3D\"text/javascript\">=\n=0Atry {=0Avar pageTracker =3D _gat._getTracker(\"UA-8410440-1\");=0ApageTrac=\nker._trackPageview();=0A} catch(err) {}</script>=0A</body>=0A</html>=0A", "code": 200, "level": 2, "url": "http://alexandregallery.com/exhibitions/pressRelease/76", "text": "Press Release", "time": 0.24619197845458984, "redirect_urls": [], "headers": {"Content-Length": "2648", "Content-Encoding": "gzip", "Set-Cookie": "CAKEPHP=b3d5912680cc9fd4c85e8801073fa384; {"body": "<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC \"-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01//EN\"=0A\t \"http://www.w3.org/TR=\n/html4/strict.dtd\">=0A<head>=0A<meta name=3D\"keywords\" content=3D\"Neil Well=\niver, Lois Dodd, Brett The exhibition  includes images of the =\nplaces that have mattered most to Dodd: the  cityscapes of New York City&rs=\nquo;s Lower East Side and the woods and gardens  of mid-coastal Maine. The =\nexhibition&rsquo;s 51 works range in date from  1955&rsquo;s <em>Pasture</e=\nm> to 2010&rsquo;s self-portrait <em>Shadow with Easel</em>.</p>=0D=0A<p>&n=\nbsp;</p>=0D=0A<p>The exhibition is organized by the Kemper Museum of  Conte=\nmporary Art and curated by Barbara O'Brien, the Museum&rsquo;s chief  curat=\nor. A full-color catalogue will accompany the exhibition with  essays by O'=\nBrien; John Yau, poet, curator and professor at Rutgers  University; and Al=\nison Ferris, curator at the John Michael Kohler Art  Center, Sheboygan, Wis=\nconsin.  After showing at the Kemper Museum, the  exhibition travels to the=\n Portland Museum of Art in Maine, where it will  be on view in early 2013.\"=\n - Kemper Museum&nbsp;</p>=0D=0A<p>&nbsp;</p></div>=0A<div class=3D'goldbox=\n'>=0A\t<ul>=0A\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/view/Lois-Dodd\" class=3D\"title\">Lo=\nis Dodd</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/exhibitions/view/91\"><span class=\n=3D'title'>Catching the Light at the Kemper Museum</span><br>May 18 through=\n August 26, 2012</a>\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<ul>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li>Press Release</li>=0A\t\t=\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/exhibitions/press/91\">Press</a></li>=0A\t\t\t=\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</ul>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t</li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/biogra=\nphy/Lois-Dodd\">Biography</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/wor=\nksAvailable/Lois-Dodd\">Works Available</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=\n=3D\"/artists/worksExhibited/Lois-Dodd\">Works Exhibited</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t=\n\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/viewPrints/Lois-Dodd\">Prints</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t=\n\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/press/Lois-Dodd\">Press</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<=\nli><a href=3D\"/artists/essays/Lois-Dodd\">Essays &amp; Interviews</a></li>=\n=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/exhibitions/Lois-Dodd\">Past Exhibiti=\nons</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</ul>=0A</div>\t</div>=0A\t</div>=0A<div id=3D'link'>=\n=0A\t<a href=3D\"http://www.kyung.com\" target=3D\"_blank\" class=3D\"kyungLink\">=\nWeb design by kyung.com</a></div>=0A<script type=3D\"text/javascript\">=0Avar=\n gaJsHost =3D ((\"https:\" =3D=3D document.location.protocol) ? class=3D\"MsoNormal\" style=3D\"tex=\nt-align: justify;\"><strong><span style=3D\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roma=\nn&quot;;\">&nbsp;</span></strong></p>=0D=0A<p><span style=3D\"font-family:
