Roman&quot;;\">The gallery is ple=\nased to present an exhibition of new paintings by Gregory Amenoff opening O=\nctober 14<sup>th</sup>.&nbsp; This show will include sixteen medium and sma=\nll-scaled oil on wood panel works completed over the past two years (2009 &=\nndash; 2010) at Amenoff&rsquo;s Ulster County, New York studio.&nbsp; It ma=\nrks the artist&rsquo;s third exhibition with the gallery.</span></p>=0D=0A<=\np class=3D\"MsoNormal\" style=3D\"text-align: justify;\"><span style=3D\"font-fa=\nmily: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;\">&nbsp;</span></p>=0D=0A<p class=3D\"MsoN=\normal\" style=3D\"text-align: justify;\"><span style=3D\"font-family: &quot;Tim=\nes New Roman&quot;;\">For over thirty years Amenoff has pursued his vision o=\nf intense, romantic, physical, and densely woven semi-abstract landscape pa=\nintings based on observation and personal interpretation of the natural wor=\nld.&nbsp; His paintings capture the sublime feeling of awe before nature an=\nd evoke the varied emotional power of the viewer&rsquo;s experience there.&=\nnbsp; Amenoff&rsquo;s paintings seldom describe specific observed sites; in=\nstead they describe the psychic possibilities and the realities of felt pla=\nces.&nbsp; The viewpoint is often of an implied figure looking into a highl=\ny imagined world. Among the titles for the new paintings are <em>Angel</em>=\n, <em>At All Hours</em>,<em> Bocage</em>, <em>Ribbonfall</em>, and <em>Wher=\ne We Go To Get Lost</em>.</span></p>=0D=0A<p class=3D\"MsoNormal\" style=3D\"t=\next-align: justify;\"><span style=3D\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot=\n;;\">&nbsp;</span></p>=0D=0A<p class=3D\"MsoNormal\" style=3D\"text-align: just=\nify;\"><span style=3D\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;\">One recurri=\nng motif in Amenoff&rsquo;s new paintings is a lyrical calligraphic leafed =\nvine.&nbsp; The vine is painted in varying forms and colors against differe=\nnt grounds &ndash; in some panels moving from dark to light, and in others =\nfrom light to dark.&nbsp; The compositions are often divided between opposi=\ntes &ndash; bright yellow light and deep celestial blue, or lush fertile gr=\neen against arid brown or salt white.&nbsp; One critic has said of Amenoff&=\nrsquo;s recent work, &ldquo;Color and contrasts of light and dark are pumpe=\nd up to melodramatic effect.&nbsp; It&rsquo;s as though you were seeing thr=\nough the eyes of someone having a transcendental revelation . . . Mr. Ameno=\nff lays on color in generous, brushy strokes, grounding cosmic ecstasy in v=\niscous paint.&rdquo; (Ken Johnson, <em>New York Times</em>, October 31, 200=\n8).</span></p>=0D=0A<p class=3D\"MsoNormal\" style=3D\"text-align: justify;\"><=\nspan style=3D\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;\">&nbsp;</span></p>=\n=0D=0A<p class=3D\"MsoNormal\" style=3D\"text-align: justify;\"><!--[if gte mso=\n 9]><xml> <o:OfficeDocumentSettings> <o:AllowPNG /> </o:OfficeDocumentSetti=\nngs> </xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml> <w:WordDocument> <w:Zoom>0<=\n/w:Zoom> <w:TrackMoves>false</w:TrackMoves> <w:TrackFormatting /> <w:Punctu=\nationKerning /> <w:DrawingGridHorizontalSpacing>18 pt</w:DrawingGridHorizon=\ntalSpacing> <w:DrawingGridVerticalSpacing>18 pt</w:DrawingGridVerticalSpaci=\nng> <w:DisplayHorizontalDrawingGridEvery>0</w:DisplayHorizontalDrawingGridE=\nvery> <w:DisplayVerticalDrawingGridEvery>0</w:DisplayVerticalDrawingGridEve=\nry> <w:ValidateAgainstSchemas /> <w:SaveIfXMLInvalid>false</w:SaveIfXMLInva=\nlid> <w:IgnoreMixedContent>false</w:IgnoreMixedContent> <w:AlwaysShowPlaceh=\nolderText>false</w:AlwaysShowPlaceholderText> <w:Compatibility> <w:BreakWra=\nppedTables /> <w:DontGrowAutofit /> <w:DontAutofitConstrainedTables /> <w:D=\nontVertAlignInTxbx /> </w:Compatibility> </w:WordDocument> </xml><![endif]-=\n-><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml> <w:LatentStyles DefLockedState=3D\"false\" LatentS=\ntyleCount=3D\"276\"> </w:LatentStyles> </xml><![endif]--> <!--[if gte mso 10]=\n> <mce:style><!   /* Style Definitions */ table.MsoNormalTable \t{mso-style-=\nname:\"Table Normal\"; \tmso-tstyle-rowband-size:0; \tmso-tstyle-colband-size:0=\n; \tmso-style-noshow:yes; \tmso-style-parent:\"\"; \tmso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0=\nin 5.4pt; \tmso-para-margin:0in; \tmso-para-margin-bottom:.0001pt; \tmso-pagin=\nation:widow-orphan; \tfont-size:12.0pt; \tfont-family:\"Times New Roman\"; \tmso=\n-ascii-font-family:Cambria; \tmso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin; \tmso-fareast=\n-font-family:\"Times New Roman\"; \tmso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast; \tmso=\n-hansi-font-family:Cambria; \tmso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;} --> <!--[en=\ndif]--> <!--StartFragment--></p>=0D=0A<p class=3D\"MsoNormal\" style=3D\"text-=\nalign: justify;\">Gregory Amenoff (b. 1948) lives and works in New York City=\n and Ulster County.&nbsp; Amenoff has taught at Columbia University for the=\n past sixteen years, where he is Eve and Herman Gelman Chair of the Visual =\nArts Division.&nbsp; He is the recipient of numerous awards from organizati=\nons including the American Academy of Arts and Letters, National Endowment =\nfor the Arts, New York State Council on the Arts and Tiffany Foundation.&nb=\nsp; He has had over fifty one-person exhibitions in museums and galleries t=\nhroughout the United States and Europe. His work is in the permanent collec=\ntions of museums including the Whitney Museum of American Art, the Museum o=\nf Fine Arts in Boston, the Museum of Modern Art in New York and the Metropo=\nlitan Museum of Art.&nbsp; He served as President of the National Academy o=\nf Design (2001 &ndash; 2005).&nbsp; He is a founding member of the Cue Art =\nFoundation where he serves on its Board.</p>=0D=0A<!--EndFragment-->=0D=0A<=\np>&nbsp;</p>=0D=0A<p class=3D\"MsoNormal\" style=3D\"text-align: justify;\"><sp=\nan style=3D\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;\">&nbsp;</span></p>=0D=\n=0A<p class=3D\"MsoNormal\" style=3D\"text-align: justify;\"><span style=3D\"fon=\nt-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;\">For further information and/or imag=\nes contact Allison Hester at 212-755-2828 or at &lt;ahester@alexandregaller=\ny.com&gt;</span><span style=3D\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;\"><=\n/span></p>=0D=0A<p class=3D\"MsoNormal\" style=3D\"text-align: justify;\"><span=\n style=3D\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;\">&nbsp;</span></p>=0D=\n=0A<p class=3D\"MsoNormal\" style=3D\"text-align: justify;\"><span style=3D\"fon=\nt-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;\">&nbsp;</span></p>=0D=0A<!--EndFragm=\nent--></div>=0A<div class=3D'goldbox'>=0A\t<ul>=0A\t\t\t\t<li><a Paintings</span><br>October 14 through November 27, 2010</a>\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<ul>=0A=\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li>Press Release</li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a {"body": "<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC \"-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01//EN\"=0A\t \"http://www.w3.org/TR=\n/html4/strict.dtd\">=0A<head>=0A<meta name=3D\"keywords\" content=3D\"Neil Well=\niver, Lois Dodd, Brett Bigbee, Gregory Amenoff, Loren MacIver, Emily Nellig=\nan, Tom Uttech, Vincent Smith, Arthur Dove, Marsden Hartley, John Marin, Al=\nfred Maurer, Stuart Davis, Stieglitz, Anne Harris, Modernist, American Art\">=\n=0A<meta name=3D\"description\" content=3D\"ALEXANDRE GALLERY, NYC, 212-755-28=\n28, Contemporary American art and early 20th century American Modernists an=\nd Stieglitz Group\">=0A<meta name=3D\"verify-v1\" content=3D\"MA5XFwrfN0KkG3+UK=\n7p1WU8QgJeH51m0xmvW9PNd5Kg=3D\"/>\t=0A<meta http-equiv=3D\"Content-Type\" conte=\nnt=3D\"text/html; charset=3Dutf-8\" /> =0A<title>ALEXANDRE GALLERY | Gregory =\nAmenoff | Biography</title>=0A<link href=3D\"/favicon.ico\" type=3D\"image/x-i=\ncon\" rel=3D\"icon\" /><link href=3D\"/favicon.ico\" type=3D\"image/x-icon\" rel=\n=3D\"shortcut icon\" /><link rel=3D\"stylesheet\" type=3D\"text/css\" href=3D\"/cs=\ns/main.css\" /> =0A=0A<!--[if lte IE 6]>=0A<style type=3D\"text/css\" media=3D=\n\"screen\">=0A\t#wrapper {=0A\t\toverflow:visible;=0A\t}\t\t=0A</style>=0A<![endif]=\n-->=0A=0A<script type=3D\"text/javascript\" src=3D\"/js/artwork.js\"></script><=\n/head>=0A<body>=0A<div id=3D'wrapper'>=0A\t<div id=3D\"header\">=0A\t\t<div id=\n=3D\"topspacer\">&nbsp;</div>=0A\t\t<a href=3D\"/pages\" class=3D\"logo\"><span>Hom=\ne</span></a>\t\t<div id=3D'menu'>=0A\t\t\t<table class=3D'menu'>=0A\t\t\t\t<tr>=0A\t\t=\n\t\t\t<td width=3D'122'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/exhibitions/current\">Current Exhi=\nbition</a>\t\t\t\t\t=0A\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/asse=\nts/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'141'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=\n=3D\"/exhibitions/upcoming\">Upcoming Exhibitions</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td cl=\nass=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<=\ntd width=3D'111'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/exhibitions/past\">Past Exhibitions</a=\n>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" =\nalt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'105'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/artists\">Art=\nists &amp; Work</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/ass=\nets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'173'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a hre=\nf=3D\"/artists/americanModernists\">American Modernist Works</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A=\n\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></t=\nd>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'70'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/pages/contact\">Contact</a>\t=\n\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" al=\nt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'60'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/artists/prints\"=\n>Prints</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t</tr>=0A\t\t\t</table>=0A\t\t</div>=0A\t</div>=0A\t<di=\nv id=3D'content'>=0A\t\t\t\t<div class=3D'top-left-image'>=0A\t<a href=3D\"/artis=\nts/view/1\"><img src=3D\"/img/uploads/med_GA87_01Centrum.jpg\" class=3D\"floatL=\neft goldbox\" alt=3D\"Centrum\" /></a></div>=0A<div class=3D'text'>=0A\t<span c=\nlass=3D'title'><a href=3D\"/artists/view/Gregory-Amenoff\">Gregory Amenoff</a=\n> | Biography</span>\t<br><br>=0A\t<p>Gregory Amenoff (b. 1948) is a painter =\nwho lives in New York and New Mexico.&nbsp; He is the recipient of numerous=\n awards from organizations including the American Academy of Arts and Lette=\nrs, National Endowment for the Arts, New York State Council on the Arts and=\n Tiffany Foundation.&nbsp; He has had over fifty one-person exhibitions in =\nmuseums and galleries throughout the United States and Europe.&nbsp; His wo=\nrk is in the permanent collections of more than thirty museums, including t=\nhe Whitney Museum of America Art, the Museum of Fine Arts in Boston, the Mu=\nseum of Modern Art in New York and the Metropolitan Museum of Art.&nbsp; He=\n served as President of the National Academy of Design from 2001-2005.&nbsp=\n; He serves on the Board of Directors of the CUE Art Foundation and as the =\nFoundation Curator Governor.&nbsp; Amenoff has taught at Columbia for the l=\nast fifteen years, where he holds the Eve and Herman Gelman Chair of Visual=\n Arts.</p>=0D=0A<p>&nbsp;</p>=0D=0A<p><span style=3D\"font-family: Arial,Hel=\nvetica,Geneva,Swiss,SunSans-Regular;\"><strong>Selected Solo Exhibitions</st=\nrong></span></p>=0D=0A<p>&nbsp;</p>=0D=0A<p>2007</p>=0D=0A<p>Facing North, =\nAlexandre Gallery, New York, NY</p>=0D=0A<p>&nbsp;</p>=0D=0A<p>2004</p>=0D=\n=0A<p>Gregory Amenoff, Recent Work, DNA Gallery, Provincetown, MA</p>=0D=0A=\n<p>&nbsp;</p>=0D=0A<p><span style=3D\"font-family: Arial,Helvetica,Geneva,Sw=\niss,SunSans-Regular;\"> 2003<br /> Gregory Amenoff: Paintings and Works on P=\naper, Salander O'Reilly Galleries, New York, NY</span></p>=0D=0A<p><span st=\nyle=3D\"font-family: Arial,Helvetica,Geneva,Swiss,SunSans-Regular;\">Raimondi=\n Collects: A 25 Year Survey of Gregory Amenoff, John Raimondi Gallery at Vi=\ntale, Cuturano and Co. Monday, February 13th.<br>\t<br>=0A\t<p><span style=3D\"font-family: C=\nalibri,Verdana,Helvetica,Arial;\"><span style=3D\"font-size: 10.5pt;\">The gal=\nlery is pleased to announce that Will Barnet has received the 2011 National=\n Medal of Arts in a White House ceremony hosted by President Obama in the E=\nast Room on Monday, February 13th, at 1:45 pm.&nbsp;&nbsp; <br /></span></s=\npan></p>=0D=0A<p>&nbsp;</p>=0D=0A<p><span style=3D\"font-family: Calibri,Ver=\ndana,Helvetica,Arial;\"><span style=3D\"font-size: 10.5pt;\">\"Will Barnet <em>=\nfor his contributions as an American painter, printmaker, and teacher. &nbs=\np;His nuanced and graceful depictions of family and personal scenes, for wh=\nich he is best known, are meticulously constructed of flat planes that reve=\nal a lifelong exploration of abstraction, expressionism, and geometry. &nbs=\np;For over 80 years, Mr. Barnet has been a constant force in the visual art=\ns world, marrying sophistication and emotion with beauty and form.\" &nbsp;<=\n/em></span></span></p>=0D=0A<p>&nbsp;</p>=0D=0A<p><span style=3D\"font-famil=\ny: Calibri,Verdana,Helvetica,Arial;\"><span style=3D\"font-size: 10.5pt;\">We =\ncongratulate Mr. Barnet on this honor. &nbsp;Barnet's work was recently the=\n subject of a career retrospective in New York at the National Academy Muse=\num. &nbsp;An exhibition of major figurative paintings from the 1980s is pla=\nnned for the 2012 &ndash; 2013 gallery season.</span></span></p>=0D=0A<p>&n=\nbsp;</p>=0D=0A<p>&nbsp;</p>=0D=0A<p><span style=3D\"font-family: Calibri,Ver=\ndana,Helvetica,Arial;\"><span style=3D\"font-size: 10.5pt;\">Watch the video o=\nf the ceremony here: <a href=3D\"http://www.whitehouse.gov/photos-and-video/=\nvideo/2012/02/13/2011-national-medals-arts-and-humanities-ceremony\" target=\n=3D\"_blank\" title=3D\"Will Barnet receives 2011 National Medal of Arts\">http=\n://www.whitehouse.gov/photos-and-video/video/2012/02/13/2011-national-medal=\ns-arts-and-humanities-ceremony</a><a href=3D\"http://www.youtube.com/watch?f=\neature=3Dplayer_embedded&amp;v=3DAzYC3eYjqG8#!\" title=3D\"VIDEO: Will Barnet=\n receives 2011 National Medal of Arts\"></a><br /></span></span></p></div>=\n=0A<div class=3D'goldbox'>=0A\t<ul>=0A\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/view/Will-=\nBarnet\" class=3D\"title\">Will Barnet</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/exhib=\nitions/view/90\"><span class=3D'title'>2011 National Medal of Arts</span><br=\n>February 11 through February 25, 2012</a>\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<ul>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li>P=\nress Release</li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/exhibitions/press/90=\n\">Press</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</ul>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t</li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a h=\nref=3D\"/artists/biography/Will-Barnet\">Biography</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li=\n><a href=3D\"/artists/worksAvailable/Will-Barnet\">Works Available</a></li>=\n=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/worksExhibited/Will-Barnet\">Works Ex=\nhibited</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/press/Will-Barnet\">P=\nress</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/essays/Will-Barnet\">Ess=\nays &amp; American Art, You=\nngstown, Ohio.</p>=0D=0A<p class=3D\"MsoNormal\">&nbsp;</p>=0D=0A<p class=3D\"=\nMsoNormal\">1997</p>=0D=0A<p class=3D\"MsoNormal\">Century Master, The Century=\n Association, New York, New York.</p>=0D=0A<p class=3D\"MsoNormal\">&nbsp;</p=\n>=0D=0A<p class=3D\"MsoNormal\">2000</p>=0D=0A<p class=3D\"MsoNormal\">Artist&r=\nsquo;s Lifetime Achievement Award Medal, National Academy of Design, New Yo=\nrk,<span>&nbsp;</span>New York.</p>=0D=0A<p class=3D\"MsoNormal\">&nbsp;</p>=\n=0D=0A<p class=3D\"MsoNormal\">2008</p>=0D=0A<p class=3D\"MsoNormal\">Maine in =\nAmerica Award, The Farnsworth Art Museum, Rockland, Maine.</p>=0D=0A<p clas=\ns=3D\"MsoNormal\">&nbsp;</p>=0D=0A<p class=3D\"MsoNormal\">=0D=0A<p class=3D\"Ms=\noNormal\" style=3D\"padding: 0px; margin: 0px;\">2011</p>=0D=0A<p class=3D\"Mso=\nNormal\" style=3D\"padding: 0px; margin: 0px;\">National Medal of Arts, presen=\nted by President Obama, Washington, DC.</p>=0D=0A<div><br Work</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets=\n/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'173'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=\n=3D\"/artists/americanModernists\">American Modernist Works</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t=\n\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=\n=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'70'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/pages/contact\">Contact</a>\t\t\t=\n\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=\n=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'60'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/artists/prints\">=\nPrints</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t</tr>=0A\t\t\t</table>=0A\t\t</div>=0A\t</div>=0A\t<div=\n id=3D'content'>=0A\t\t\t\t<div class=3D'top-left-image'>=0A\t<a href=3D\"/artist=\ns/view/3\"><img src=3D\"/img/uploads/med_MB73_CraggyTrunks1.jpg\" class=3D\"flo=\natLeft goldbox\" alt=3D\"\" /></a></div>=0A<div class=3D'text'>=0A\t<span class=\n=3D'title'><a href=3D\"/artists/view/Marvin-Bileck\">Marvin Bileck</a> | Biog=\nraphy</span>\t<br><br>=0A\t<p><span style=3D\"font-family: Arial,Helvetica,Gen=\neva,Swiss,SunSans-Regular;\">MARVIN BILECK<br /> <br /> BIOGRAPHY<br /> <br =\n/> Marvin Bileck was born in Passaic, New Jersey in 1920. He is a graduate =\nof the Cooper Union School of Art in New York City and did additional study=\n at the London School of Architecture and Columbia University. Bileck recei=\nved a Fullbright Fellowship to France where he continued his studies in the=\n Cabinet des Dessins at the Louvre Museum while working in the printing ate=\nliers of Lacouriere and Desjouibert.<br /> <br /> His work has been widely =\nrepresented in gallery exhibitions including A.I.R. Gallery and Landmark Ga=\nllery in New York City, Queens College Art Center, Westminster College Art =\nGallery (PA), Dartmouth College (NH), Maine Coast Artists Gallery, Islesfor=\nd Artists Gallery (ME), Ann Weber Gallery (ME), Washington Art Association =\n(CT), and Paesaggio Gallery (CT). In addition he has had work exhibited in =\nthe following museums: the metropolitan Museum of Art, Philadelphia Museum =\nof Art, Chicago Art Institute, Queens Museum and the Slater Museum (CT). Bi=\nleck&rsquo;s work is represented in numerous public and private collections=\n throughout the United States, Europe and Japan.<br /> <br /> William Zimme=\nr, writing in the New York Times has said that &ldquo;Marvin Bileck is an e=\ntcher and his etch line is delicate. The paradox he shows us is that delica=\ncy and ruggedness can coexist perfectly.&rdquo;<br /> Marvin Bileck was als=\no a highly respected and influential teacher at Philadelphia College of Art=\n (now The University of the Arts) and Queens College where he is Professor =\nEmeritus. His residence and studio are located in Winsted, Connecticut.</sp=\nan></p></div>=0A<div class=3D'goldbox'>=0A\t<ul>=0A\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artis=\nts/view/Marvin-Bileck\" class=3D\"title\">Marvin Bileck</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t=\n\t\t\t\t<li>Biography</li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/worksExhibited=\n/Marvin-Bileck\">Works Exhibited</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/arti=\nsts/press/Marvin-Bileck\">Press</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artis=\nts/essays/Marvin-Bileck\">Essays &amp; Interviews</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li=\n><a href=3D\"/artists/exhibitions/Marvin-Bileck\">Past Exhibitions</a></li>=\n=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</ul>=0A</div>\t</div>=0A\t</div>=0A<div id=3D'link'>=0A\t<a href=\n=3D\"http://www.kyung.com\" target=3D\"_blank\" class=3D\"kyungLink\">Web design =\nby kyung.com</a></div>=0A<script type=3D\"text/javascript\">=0Avar gaJsHost =\n=3D ((\"https:\" =3D=3D document.location.protocol) ? {"body": "<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC \"-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01//EN\"=0A\t \"http://www.w3.org/TR=\n/html4/strict.dtd\">=0A<head>=0A<meta name=3D\"keywords\" content=3D\"Neil Well=\niver, Lois Dodd, Brett Bigbee, Gregory Amenoff, Loren MacIver, Emily Nellig=\nan, Tom Uttech, Vincent Smith, Arthur Dove, Marsden Hartley, John Marin, Al=\nfred Maurer, Stuart Davis, Stieglitz, Anne Harris, Modernist, American Art\">=\n=0A<meta name=3D\"description\" content=3D\"ALEXANDRE GALLERY, NYC, 212-755-28=\n28, Contemporary American art and early 20th century American Modernists an=\nd Stieglitz Group\">=0A<meta name=3D\"verify-v1\" content=3D\"MA5XFwrfN0KkG3+UK=\n7p1WU8QgJeH51m0xmvW9PNd5Kg=3D\"/>\t=0A<meta http-equiv=3D\"Content-Type\" conte=\nnt=3D\"text/html; charset=3Dutf-8\" /> =0A<title>ALEXANDRE GALLERY | Emily Ne=\nlligan & Marvin Bileck | Press Release</title>=0A<link href=3D\"/favicon.ico=\n\" type=3D\"image/x-icon\" rel=3D\"icon\" /><link href=3D\"/favicon.ico\" type=3D\"=\nimage/x-icon\" rel=3D\"shortcut icon\" /><link rel=3D\"stylesheet\" type=3D\"text=\n/css\" href=3D\"/css/main.css\" /> =0A=0A<!--[if lte IE 6]>=0A<style type=3D\"t=\next/css\" media=3D\"screen\">=0A\t#wrapper {=0A\t\toverflow:visible;=0A\t}\t\t=0A</s=\ntyle>=0A<![endif]-->=0A=0A<script type=3D\"text/javascript\" src=3D\"/js/artwo=\nrk.js\"></script></head>=0A<body>=0A<div id=3D'wrapper'>=0A\t<div id=3D\"heade=\nr\">=0A\t\t<div id=3D\"topspacer\">&nbsp;</div>=0A\t\t<a href=3D\"/pages\" class=3D\"=\nlogo\"><span>Home</span></a>\t\t<div id=3D'menu'>=0A\t\t\t<table class=3D'menu'>=\n=0A\t\t\t\t<tr>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'122'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/exhibitions/curre=\nnt\">Current Exhibition</a>\t\t\t\t\t=0A\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img =\nsrc=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'141'>=\n=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/exhibitions/upcoming\">Upcoming Exhibitions</a>\t\t\t\t\t</t=\nd>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" =\n/></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'111'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/exhibitions/past\">Pas=\nt Exhibitions</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/asset=\ns/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'105'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=\n=3D\"/artists\">Artists &amp; Work</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><im=\ng src=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'173=\n'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/artists/americanModernists\">American Modernist Works=\n</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gi=\nf\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'70'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/pages/cont=\nact\">Contact</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets=\n/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'60'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D=\n\"/artists/prints\">Prints</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t</tr>=0A\t\t\t</table>=0A\t\t</div>=\n=0A\t</div>=0A\t<div id=3D'content'>=0A\t\t\t\t<div class=3D'top-left-image'>=0A\t=\n<a href=3D\"/exhibitions/view/62\"><img src=3D\"/img/uploads/med_EN_26Sept07.j=\npg\" class=3D\"floatLeft goldbox\" alt=3D\"26 Sept 07\" /></a></div>=0A<div clas=\ns=3D'text'>=0A\t<span class=3D'title'>\t<a href=3D\"/exhibitions/view/62\">Emil=\ny Nelligan &amp; Marvin Bileck</a> | Press Release</span>=0A\t<br><br>=0A\t<s=\npan class=3D'bold'>=0A\t\tEmily Nelligan & Marvin Bileck</span><br>=0A\tRecent=\n Drawings by Emily Nelligan and Selected Illustrations by Marvin Bileck<br>=\n\tExtended through January 23rd, 2010<br>\t<br>=0A\t<p style=3D\"text-align: ju=\nstify;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbs=\np;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nb=\nsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp=\n;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&n=\nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp=\n;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&n=\nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; For Immediate Release &ndash; Octo=\nber 2009</p>=0D=0A<p style=3D\"text-align: justify;\">&nbsp;</p>=0D=0A<p styl=\ne=3D\"text-align: justify;\">&nbsp;</p>=0D=0A<p style=3D\"text-align: justify;=\n\">&nbsp;</p>=0D=0A<p style=3D\"text-align: justify;\"><br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp=\n; The gallery is pleased to present two exhibitions: Marvin Bileck: Figurat=\nive Etchings and Illustrations and Emily Nelligan: Recent Drawings.&nbsp; B=\noth shows open November 19th with a reception on Saturday, November 21st, f=\nrom noon to 2 pm. This marks the gallery&rsquo;s second joint exhibitions o=\nf these artists&rsquo; work.<br /><br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The subjects of =\nBileck&rsquo;s meticulous and finely detailed drawings and prints range fro=\nm delicate linear depictions of complex tangled and layered landscapes to h=\nighly imaginative and whimsical children&rsquo;s illustrations that are equ=\nally dense and delicate.&nbsp; Among the works included in the current show=\n will be original drawings from his 1965 <span style=3D\"text-decoration: un=\nderline;\">Rain Makes Applesauce </span>(written by Alfred Kazin) and a suit=\ne of fanciful figurative etchings that evoke the finest tradition of Northe=\nrn European graphic art.<br /><br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; By contrast, Emily N=\nelligan works only with unfixed charcoal, graphite and erasure on 7 by 10 i=\nnch sheets of thin cotton writing paper.&nbsp; In her work, she distills th=\ne observed landscape of a Maine island and its coast, rocks, trees, sea, li=\nght and mist into virtuosic, semi-abstract images of shadow and light.&nbsp=\n; &ldquo;Ms. Nelligan&rsquo;s drawings are nocturnes in which light is more=\n fugitive than shadow and a velvety darkness dominates every prospect (Hilt=\non Kramer, 2005).&rdquo;&nbsp; Included in this show are twenty drawings fr=\nom the past four summers.<br /><br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Bileck, who died in=\n 2005, and Nelligan met in the 1940s when both were students at Cooper Unio=\nn and married soon after.&nbsp; Since that time they divided their time bet=\nween New York, Connecticut and Maine.&nbsp; For many summers the two artist=\ns worked together every day on Great Cranberry Island (Maine) in the mornin=\ng and again at twilight.</p></div>=0A<div class=3D'goldbox'>=0A\t<ul>=0A\t\t\t\t=\n\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/exhibitions/view/62\"><span class=3D'title'>Emily Nelliga=\nn & Marvin Bileck</span><br>Recent Drawings by Emily Nelligan and Selected =\nIllustrations by Marvin Bileck<br>November 19, 2009 through January 23, 201=\n0</a>\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<ul>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li>Press Release</li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t=\n\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/exhibitions/press/62\">Press</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t=\n\t<li>Related Artists\t\t\t\t\t\t<ul>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/view\"=\n>Marvin Bileck</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/view\">Emily =\nNelligan</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</ul>=0A\t\t\t\t\t</li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</ul>=0A\t=\n\t\t\t\t\t</li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t</ul>=0A</div>\t</div>=0A\t</div>=0A<div id=3D'link'>=0A\t<a=\n href=3D\"http://www.kyung.com\" target=3D\"_blank\" class=3D\"kyungLink\">Web de=\nsign by kyung.com</a></div>=0A<script type=3D\"text/javascript\">=0Avar gaJsH=\nost =3D ((\"https:\" =3D=3D document.location.protocol) ? \"https://ssl.\" :=0A=\n\"http://www.\");=0Adocument.write(unescape(\"%3Cscript src=3D'\" + gaJsHost +=\n=0A\"google-analytics.com/ga.js' type=3D'text/javascript'%3E%3C/script%3E\"));=\n=0A</script>=0A<script type=3D\"text/javascript\">=0Atry {=0Avar pageTracker =\n=3D _gat._getTracker(\"UA-8410440-1\");=0ApageTracker._trackPageview();=0A} c=\natch(err) {}</script>=0A</body>=0A</html>=0A", "code": 200, "level": 2, "url": "http://alexandregallery.com/exhibitions/pressRelease/62", "text": "Press Release", "time": 0.3423440456390381, "redirect_urls": [], "headers": {"Content-Length": "2607", "Content-Encoding": "gzip", "Set-Cookie": "CAKEPHP=59239732501a7a60508fb06fe2797cd9; {"body": "<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC \"-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01//EN\"=0A\t \"http://www.w3.org/TR=\n/html4/strict.dtd\">=0A<head>=0A<meta name=3D\"keywords\" content=3D\"Neil Well=\niver, Lois Dodd, Brett class=3D\"logo\"><span>Home</span></a>\t\t<div id=3D'menu'>=0A\t\t\t<table cla=\nss=3D'menu'>=0A\t\t\t\t<tr>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'122'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/exhib=\nitions/current\">Current Exhibition</a>\t\t\t\t\t=0A\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=\n=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td =\nwidth=3D'141'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a width=3D'111'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/exhibit=\nions/past\">Past Exhibitions</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img src=\n=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td width=3D'105'>=0A=\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/artists\">Artists &amp; Work</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td clas=\ns=3D'img'><img src=3D\"/img/assets/l-circle.gif\" alt=3D\"\" /></td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td=\n width=3D'173'>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t<a href=3D\"/artists/americanModernists\">American Mo=\ndernist Works</a>\t\t\t\t\t</td>=0A\t\t\t\t\t<td class=3D'img'><img href=3D\"/exhibitions/view/79\"><img src=3D\"/img/uploads/me=\nd_ARN88_02Monte_II_PhotoDJamesDee_detail.jpg\" class=3D\"floatLeft goldbox\" a=\nlt=3D\"Monte II\" /></a></div>=0A<div class=3D'text'>=0A\t<span class=3D'title=\n'><a href=3D\"/artists/view/46\">Anne Arnold</a> | \t<a href=3D\"/exhibitions/v=\niew/79\">Sculpture from Four Decades</a> | Press Release</span>=0A\t<br><br>=\n=0A\t<span class=3D'bold'>=0A\tAnne Arnold | \tSculpture from Four Decades</sp=\nan><br>=0A\tDATES EXTENDED<br>\tApril 26 through July 27, 2012<br>An abbrevia=\nted version of this exhibiton will be on view June 18th through July 27th.<=\nbr>\t<br>=0A\t<!--StartFragment-->=0D=0A<p><span style=3D\"font-size: x-small;=\n\"><span style=3D\"font-family: Calibri, Verdana, Helvetica, Arial;\"><span st=\nyle=3D\"font-size: 10pt;\">The gallery will present the first one-person exhi=\nbition of Anne Arnold&rsquo;s sculpture in twenty-four years. &nbsp;Surveyi=\nng work from the 1950s through the 1980s, <strong><em>Anne Arnold: Sculptur=\ne from Four Decades</em></strong> will include 27 classic examples of her a=\nnimals in wood, ceramic, metal and painted or resin-coated canvas stretched=\n over wooden armatures. &nbsp;These works range from a roughly carved creos=\note coated pine sphinx-like cat to the front end of a life-sized horse in a=\nn unbalanced moment of rising up on its legs. <br /> &nbsp;<br /> &nbsp;&nb=\nsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In a period =\nwhen Abstract Expressionism, Minimalism, Pop Art and many other movements c=\name and went, Arnold persisted down her own path, eventually defining a sin=\ngular position in American sculpture. While Arnold&rsquo;s own early role i=\nn the development and wide acceptance of Pop is made clear,</span></span></=\nspan><span style=3D\"font-family: Calibri, Verdana, Helvetica, Arial;\"><span=\n style=3D\"font-size: 12pt;\"> </span><span style=3D\"font-size: x-small;\"><sp=\nan style=3D\"font-size: 10pt;\">it can also be argued that Arnold understood =\nbetter than her peers the traditions of the first &ldquo;popular&rdquo; Ame=\nrican art forms found in vernacular, vintage folk objects such as weatherva=\nnes, decoys and hand-painted country advertising.<br /> &nbsp;<br /> &nbsp;=\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Arnold&rs=\nquo;s work is quirky and personal, and humor is often a characteristic. &nb=\nsp;Her animals&rsquo; body language is spot-on, whether it be the stretchin=\ng lean of a cat, the raked ears of a crouching rabbit, or the unexpected li=\nghtness and grace of a large farm animal. &nbsp;We know an animal different=\nly after seeing one </span></span><span style=3D\"font-size: 12pt;\"> </span>=\n<span style=3D\"font-size: x-small;\"><span style=3D\"font-size: 10pt;\">of Arn=\nold&rsquo;s sculptures and, perhaps, care about them more for their individ=\nual traits evoked so precisely as essential form, gesture and presence.<br =\n/> </span></span><span style=3D\"font-size: 12pt;\"><br /> &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;=\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=3D\"font-size: x-small;\"><s=\npan style=3D\"font-size: 10pt;\">This exhibition will be accompanied by a ful=\nly illustrated catalogue with texts by Christopher B. Crosman and John Yau.=\n &nbsp;The artist will be present for a reception on Saturday, April 28th, =\nfrom 1 to 4 pm.&nbsp;</span></span></span></p>=0D=0A<!--EndFragment-->=0D=\n=0A<p><span style=3D\"font-family: Calibri,Verdana,Helvetica,Arial;\"><span s=\ntyle=3D\"font-size: 10.5pt;\"></span></span></p></div>=0A<div class=3D'goldbo=\nx'>=0A\t<ul>=0A\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/view/Anne-Arnold\" class=3D\"title\"=\n>Anne Arnold</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/exhibitions/view/79\"><span c=\nlass=3D'title'>Sculpture from Four Decades</span><br>April 26 through July =\n27, 2012<br>An abbreviated version of this exhibiton will be on view June 1=\n8th through July 27th.</a>\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<ul>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li>Press Release</li>=\n=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/exhibitions/press/79\">Press</a></li>=\n=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</ul>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t</li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/=\nbiography/Anne-Arnold\">Biography</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/art=\nists/worksAvailable/Anne-Arnold\">Works Available</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li=\n><a href=3D\"/artists/worksExhibited/Anne-Arnold\">Works Exhibited</a></li>=\n=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/press/Anne-Arnold\">Press</a></li>=0A=\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/essays/Anne-Arnold\">Essays &amp; Interv=\niews</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=3D\"/artists/exhibitions/Anne-Arnold=\n\">Past Exhibitions</a></li>=0A\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t</ul>=0A</div>\t</div>=0A\t</div>=0A<d=\niv id=3D'link'>=0A\t<a href=3D\"http://www.kyung.com\" target=3D\"_blank\" class=\n=3D\"kyungLink\">Web design by kyung.com</a></div>=0A<script type=3D\"text/jav=\nascript\">=0Avar gaJsHost =3D ((\"https:\" =3D=3D document.location.protocol) =\n?
